LWjtky-mt8ck8APdBHs7KA.text: great pub!! the fish & chips and sticky toffee pudding are amazing. strong selection of english brews.  the self-proclaimed "greatest bartender in the world" Adam actually truly was!!  excellent service and hospitality...really talks and listens to the customers! so glad we found this place. :D

SDFb45FjycbYgAxg1mWjFQ.text: Ate here for my last night in Vegas. Experience was ok. Service was slow, and the food only eh. Ordered a snakebite, and got something else than what I thought I would. (Shame on me for not specifying.) Friends said that it's a good time during football (aka soccer) season.

eCFjxIHqLnkb0T5DarlhbQ.text: Fun times to be had at the Crown and Anchor...I just love the beer selection not to mention the great atmosphere.  Anything that stands the test of time in Las Vegas is a feat.  And what more could a girl ask for that 2 women's bathrooms.  They have an Internet jukebox so the music is never dull.  I've never had bad service there and there is always an array of people.  I do adore the food...the ploughman's lunch is my favorite!  Give me wicked cheese and Branston's pickles anytime.  Fries, pasties, sausage roll and even the shrimp is good and the fish and chips EXCEL.  Great conversation seems to flow there.   Cheers!

pL9YKSCFdHibqFMh8SZanA.text: So I came to this place after reading the reviews here on Yelp and planning an annual trip I make with my father.  I wanted to find some good local places, off the strip, where the food was neither buffet nor over-priced.  Their meat pies were top notch, the cider was fresh, the beer was priced well and they carried a lot of imported foods that are hard to find most places.  Being an off strip place - it seems to cater to locals and I really liked that.  The first waitress was fabulous - fast, attentive and smiley.  The second was very friendly but much slower and less on top of things.  However she was adequate.  The only draw back to this place was how smokey it smelled - but its vegas and the law says you can smoke in the pubs so... This is a place I will definitely frequent again when I am in town.  In terms of being traditional, I am a first generation Canadian, raised by a family of Brits and I can say this is good authentic style pub.  WELL DONE!

MH1Rmfa0gGYdTY_oKalHQg.text: i love this place.  the food is always good and the enviroment is fun.  we've eaten a bunch off of the menu.  fav is fish and chips. pastie, cottage pie, chicken curry...all good.  the scotch egg is great.  dont forget to ask for HP sauce.  they make their own chips wich are tasty.  they have a lot of draft beers too.

wQCHXh4cFmgvwGzllsXbBQ.text: This is one of my favorite everyday watering holes here in Vegas.  Great selelction of beers, wonderful patio outside, pool, darts, a few TVs, lots of people--in essence everything you need to stay entertained while drinking.  The food is also very good... I had the Chicken Curry with Chips, and it was surprisingly good (either that, or I had consumed one too many black and tans). :)

IGOASH_SjVj5rghrtokycw.text: Best Fish n' Chips in Vegas and maybe anywhere.  Light batter, thick and flaky fish.  Service usually blows (they don't staff many waitresses) but the food makes up for it.

O1c7cuizH76_kejztNbzhA.text: bangers, pasties, darts, fish n chips... excellant!

6VHPPcKyVUPToTwyqPD7Nw.text: ah yes, i think i finally found my watering hole here in the las vegas.  too bad it's too far, but it has the one of the best beer tap selections in town.  i used to come here a long time ago just for the guiness, the boddingtons, and the john courage.  I learned earlier this year that john courage will not be available on tap anywhere in the U.S., so that was a bummer.  I found a great replacement...kronenberg 1664 from france.  i cant get enough of that beer and tetley's too.  this place has good food, too!  it has all those english pub specialties, even indian curry.  go there on mondays to have all you can eat fish and chips.  the fish is fried fresh...so crispy...so hot...and so yummy with malt vinegar.  they have late nite chicken sandwich and cheeseburger specials.  but the thing to get there at any time....is the chicken wing appetizer...whoa man!!!  fu#$in so delicious, my mouth is watering right now.  i dont know what it is, but it has to be that batter...so tasty,crispy,crunchy, and tangy in the dipping sauce.  we always get our grub on and order hella plates of chicken.  this is a must!!! finally, they have a special down the hatch club card where for every beer you drink you get a stamp.  when you get to 30 beers, you get a free gift.   so i and a couple of other friends are on a mission to get as many free gifts as we can.   with my first card, i got my crown & anchor down the hatch club t-shirt.  right now i'm working on the jersey.  so, check this place out.  its open 24hours

aOAk0hRgRBEqHbt8ySk_UA.text: The pub style is great, but the place feels like a sausage party.  The male to female ratio tends to be about 8:1 and of the 8, 6 are pretty douched up.  The food isn't very good....although the pies are decent.  Excellent selection of beer and fun trivia night.  The wait staff is hit or miss, and does feel a little like a strip club.  Dog friendly patio, which is great.  Not a bad place for afternoon summer drinks.

AXB29nxPQ1RNEbJ3aUdGTA.text: Forget the more American offerings on the menu.  Just have the fish and chips--with mushy peas.  Dip your chips in the mushy peas instead of the tartar sauce.  Their fish and chips are perfection, and English-style perfection at that.

glJfOsvjUU7bZNk0YsiUew.text: i was here last night, not to count the numerous previous visits. this is my friend's favorite pub! and it is my #2 pub for there delicious food. they got awesome apple cobblers, and cottage pie is my favorite dish here.  they got chimay on tab which is one of my favorite beer. everytime i go to this pub i get a kick out of it.  there are times like on the weekends where it will take a while for services but still the staff here is very friendly. :) i'll definitely be back!

oNJnn3aclnebwqZGVV_o0Q.text: Came here to watch Manchester Unites play today. This place is great to watched the matches. They are open 24 hours so you can catch any game(even the ones at 4am). They have good prices on food and drinks. They also have a great draft selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place to watch the matches!

YQuWzRAM6hAhOJI59sQBpg.text: I know this is mainly a bar for drinking and watching sports, but they serve up some especially bad tasting and horribly prepared food here.  I initially ordered the steak and mushroom pie, I had it sent away since they felt the need to only put two pieces of steak in the entire pie. The fish and chips I got instead was so flavorless and overly battered. It was noted by my other companions that it looked like I was eating a baked potato with how much batter I was digging through just to eat some fish. The fries were unseasoned, soggy, not crisp, and straight out of a Ore-Ida bag.  Is salt and pepper illegal in Britain? Since I was with my buddies, I was able to try other things at the table. Nothing was seasoned and didn't have any taste unless it was drowning in their brown gravy or came with a dipping sauce. Out the can peas were on both of my plates. Barely warm, no salt, no pepper, no butter, no olive oil.  After paying 18+ bucks for food and drinks, and being stuck eating mostly french fries and overly battered onion rings, I left knowing I wont be coming back here.

8n0GvuaTMpWWy5b9MluIbQ.text: The restaurant was rated by Restaurant.com and Yelp by many people as having the "best fish & chips in Las Vegas," which is in no way the truth. I ordered the fish and chips, which came with baked beans and "fresh" peas, and my friend ordered a lamb stew with yorkshire pudding. Sounds tasty, huh? Keep reading... Well, the fish was NOT seasoned at all. Although the crust was crunchy, the cod fillet was drenched in grease. Next, the baked beans were flavorless and obviously canned. Finally, my peas tasted like they were once frozen, but they had an old, dry and starchy taste. They, too were not seasoned at all. In the end, if you like fried fish, I would recommend FRESHLY prepared Long John SIlvers to this...OR even visiting the "hole in the wall" in Northtown called Marios Market (MLK/Lake Mead). The catfish there is AMAZING and made with love. Now, my friend ordered the lamb stew prepared in a yorkshire pudding bowl. Would you believe the stew was NOT lamb, but BEEF (my friend is a trained chef...he knows!) ANYONE who eats lamb can recognise its distinctive, slightly gamey flavor). And when it arrived at the table in the yorkshire pudding bowl, the stew was cool inside the bowl...as if the "chef" hadn't microwaved it long enough. Really?! How long had THAT been sitting around! Even the yorkshire pudding was soggy and old, like it was made a few days ago. So, when we informed the waitress that the stew contained beef instead of lamb, she trotted off, frustrated, and returned 15 minutes later and said..."Yep...the chef says it's lamb. YOU can SAY it's beef all day long...but I'M TELLING you it's lamb." When I asked her if she had ever eaten lamb before, she responded "No...I don't like stuff like that. But the chef told me the stew was made with lamb." Hmmm. The waitress then grew rude and condescending, as if she was exasperated by our inquiries. At least she replaced my friend's "lamb" stew with a dry, overcooked steak sandwich, which was again unseasoned. Some "chef" they have at the Crown & Anchor, huh?! What's most disappointing about my experience at the Crown & Anchor British Pub was that I'd been wanting to visit this place for some time now. I love fish and chips, and I've seen theirs touted as being so delicious. Hogwash! They must be paying people to post those comments. I would NEVER go there again...or recommend any friend to do so either. It was a 2 on a scale of 1-10. What a waste of time and money.

i3OFUFrLsgyMbt3hei4lKg.text: We both went for fish and chips,  what a major disappointment,  we got one piece of flavorless fish with fries and undercooked peas.  They didn't even drain the peas sufficiently,  so now the breaded flavorless fish and fries are soggy from the pea juice.  The waitress only came by once to check on us at the end of our meal. My wife had to twice walk to the bar to get her water refilled.   All we got was a,  "sorry,  that is our feature dish',.  Now that was scary if that's their best plate!

QTCGf8BhF5o5GKISEVXXkA.text: This is by FAR the best place to watch football (soccer) in Las Vegas, if you're looking for something more than the glitzy experiences offered by the sports bars on the strip. If you want to watch football with real football fans, to hoot and holler, then Crown and Anchor is your place.   They have a ton of European beers on tap, and they serve traditional British and Irish fare on the menu. I like the Chip Butty because, really, where else are you going to get a french fry and butter sandwich? But that's essentially what you have here: a french fry and butter sandwich.   Fans of all clubs can go here and have a good time; it isn't an Arsenal bar or a Man United Bar. It's a football bar. So if you're staying on the strip, take a taxi here and watch some football, whether you're with your mates or by yourself.

QBgXv2M8NjVcjeLRDz52Lg.text: I actually can't even believe I'm leaving this place two starters I've gone to both Crown and Anchor bars and they have both been horrible horrible experiences yucky boring food not to mention slow slow service overall just a dump!  It's kinda a place kids go to watch soccer and game on dirty machines.

Em95ho-vpjPH1Br1W4ryVA.text: EDIT: added 1 more star since the management seems to be good at replying back to customer reviews x  Bianca has horrible customer service. I asked her for a menu, she asked me to wait for just a moment. So I stepped back and waited. But then she started talking to another server, taking her time. So I asked her if I should just ask someone else, since she was busy. She rudely told me that she would get it and acted as if it was a privilege to have her help me out (like why was I even asking her for a menu??? I guess she doesn't consider it part of her job??????) Definitely ruined the night for me. Not coming back. At that point I had already ordered a glass of wine, I gave up on ordering food because I didn't want to give my hard earned money to someone so horrid. We came in with a medium sized group of girls and we were ignored until we flagged a server down. I don't know if Bianca is really her real name or if she gave me a fake name, but she was wearing a red plaid skirt with a black top with black hair. Super skinny, around 5'2. Try to get a different server if you get her. She continued to act as if she was doing me a favor by finally getting me a menu AFTER I told her I wouldn't be needing it anymore (she handed it to me with a "there, are you happy now?" kind of attitude). This review is all over the place because of how mad this girl made me. I literally could not stop shaking with how horrid her customer service was. Obviously the manager should either have a more rigorous training/hiring process or learn how to fire employees that hurt your business (as I'm sure I'm not the first one swearing never to return due to her rude ass).  EDIT: Hello Richard, thank you so much for replying, it really does make me feel much better to know that you even bothered to read my review. This situation occurred on December 16, 2015 at around 9:50pm on karaoke night. The server "Bianca" was talking to the server with curly copper hair and glasses.

y1uNgDF2JAzJ4rdavG1jUg.text: This is my go to spot for Wednesday karaoke night. Let me just say that I don't sing ever but maybe a few drinks I'll probably will go up there and give it a shot till then I'll just sit and watch haha.  I like the chicken tenders here as they're pretty good and pretty fast to get when you order.  Our bartender is pretty funny, I didn't catch his name but he made us feel welcome and when it wasn't busy he will have a great time with everyone.  The beer selections are great but I always seem to stick with Newcastle , need to open up my options haha.  Overall place is great to hang with a group of friends, there's darts downstairs and pool upstairs

aU3wSljwW7liDsAYPqt-6Q.text: The decor was nice , it reminded me of a British pub back home.  The bartender was really nice.  The food on the other hand was something else.  My husband got fish and chips which he said was an 3 out of 5. He has has better and worse.  I ordered the BIG Yorkshire Pudding. I was SO disappointed. It not only was burnt , but was TOTALLY HOLLOW in the middle.  Not ok at all  The Plomans lunch was nothing to write home about also not what I remember growing up.   The chips and butty. Was Good..   For $43 dollars it to me WAS NOT worth it ..  SORRY

msETAlwKIoaak4JN1d8zvA.text: The place was popping but the food was pooping. The service was good. The place was busy. Our food was horrible. I have been going to crown for about 10 years and haven't been there in 2 years until today. I talked about how awesome the fish and chips were and it was just mediocre and missing a filet. Honestly, I only got one filet that was a greased up hunk of cod with frozen french fries severed along with frozen rare peas for $13. Then my wife had cottage pie and it tasted like ground beef without seasoning in cheap gravy topped with basic mash potatoes and different well done frozen peas. Honestly the peas were two different colors on our two plates. I would go back to drink but not to eat until they get there stuff together again. I have are there back in the day of the "best fish and chips in vegas" and miss that. I talked about it and talked about and got let down. I actually left hungry and unable to eat my wife's entree....   If I was single I would make it a "Go To Spot" for the young drunk college girls that are over served, stumbling around, and easy pray. Glad to see that crowd back at crown!

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The peas on both plates are two different colors. One is frozen well done and frozen rare with out any seasoning.

y5vgBOvy_NS0BGdW8jPfnQ.text: Great little place, tasty grub and British fare. Exactly what it's trying to be. A piece of British civilization  inside the vast desert abyss. Came here for breakfast, because the prices are less than half of what they are on the strip. The service and food met my expectations. Cool little groove.

G4hZP1Bk3XAzPXC3qUBDCg.text: Giving this place an extra star because our server was really sweet. We came with a large group of about 15 people and they sat us in the upstairs area next to a foreboding "Max. Occupancy: 9" sign. Luckily, we all survived the experience, but the service was exceptionally slow and the food was pretty disappointing. I thought you could never go wrong with fish & chips at a British pub, but mine didn't have any flavor at all. The server felt bad that we had to wait so long so she brought us all plates of "chip butties" which are just french fries on a buttered roll. Don't knock it til you try it... that was actually better than most of our meals.  This place does seem fun as a bar since they had Monday night football on and people were very into it.

RmzypT6zXs9EaWfbjlv3Aw.text: Great place to eat late at night.  Some of the best fish and chips.  Fish and chips- 2 big fillets with a crispy flakey crust. Fish is always moist and tastes fresh. Comes with fries. Chicken fingers are good as well. This place is really close to where I live I only eat maybe once every few months. It usually satisfies tho.

ENXoT2z84AHL2t83-1HaGA.text: THE place to go if you're looking for authentic British fare (although Cornish Pasty is nipping at their heels). Have been here many times through the years and the fish and chips and chicken pot pie have never failed me.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Comp Fish and chips for $20 video poker play for lunch. Great deal!

2yCtv93Ey9UilGsn7SPJfA.text: For my first English pub, this was a good cherry popper. The service was decent and friendly.  The place is small but, good for groups.  I ordered the chicken and leek pie. I was craving a flaky meal and that's what I got. IT was delicious! However, the chicken inside tasted very much like it was from a can. Also, the mashed potatoes tasted boxed.  I probably won't order the pie again, but, the potato skins and Scottish egg will be something I will revisit.

wOq1-wQpyqF5CmYfeIUylg.text: I've been really excited to come to the crown and anchor pub for a while now. When the opportunity presented itself we visited this location for lunch. Our waitress was amazing. She was extremely friendly and personable. Atmosphere gets an A+. I had the fish and chips as the main course; which was DE. LI. CIOUS. They've definitely done it justice. Here is the bad news... My Yorkshire pudding was burnt. The gravy was tasty but it couldn't mask the taste of char. That lost you a star. The second star disappeared when I wanted to get them to redeem themselves by trying the sticky toffee pudding (one of my favourites.) Unfortunately it was dry and had the same light burnt taste. I'm pretty sure it was old. The ice cream accompanying it was also freezer burnt. Very disappointed...

Fbbr4yvi0znoACLfrNUQkQ.text: I love the character of this place and AYCE Fish n chips Mondays! good selection of beers and definitely a spot to visit in Vegas. from the old school euro car parked outside to the White House that looks like it came from a fairy tale story but full with alcohol, beer and good food. it's a gaming bar but they have tables to dine in. they also have two dart boards in the back for friendly wagers but the highlight on my visit was the fish n chips. It was moist, flakey and crunchy batter with some steak fries. Rumor has it that they have some of the best chicken fingers so I might try those next visit. Try it out! You won't be dissapointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SweJthxZb1CvHnclJw62JQ.text: Been coming to the Crown and Anchor for over 20 years. This is my Cheers. I know the owners and have had many of fun nights hanging out. The food is really good too. I love the cottage pie with HP sauce. My favorite thing about this place is they always have Grolsh in the bottle at the bar!!!!

8qQptXgxvCctFPEIqGyWUA.text: Food is mostly good. The service is the reason for the three stars though. We had two servers while we were there, one that took our order and one that brought our food. The one that took out order was fine, she got one of our orders wrong but other than that she was fine. The one that brought our food though was rude beyond belief. She acted as though we were the biggest burden and waste of her time. I still plan on coming back but swear if that woman is our server I will ask for anther one. There is no way I could handle an entire dinner of her.

EmSHcojbjTOxht0_Ti_a8w.text: We were in Vegas for my bachelor party and we were looking for a place a little bit off the strip with some good beers and decent food.  Crown and Anchor was that place for us.  I am a chicken finger nut, so hearing that they were good here, got my attention.  We were also going to be watching the US world cup game against Germany, and we found out after the fact that C&A had made the Thrillist list for top 10 places to watch soccer in the US.  While it was a little warm, the atmosphere did not disappoint.  My friends and I sat up a little upstairs nook to watch the game.  We all ordered the chicken fingers before the kitchen closed, as they were grilling burgers for the crowd that day.  The service was pretty good, given the number of people packed in the bar.  We got to try a good mix of beers and had a great time overall.

WgzyK3-Mw6yYvgF12GYc0g.text: I really like this english pub. It's one of the few ones that serve a raspberry cider around town. They also have an traditional english item called a chip bunty (or butty) which basically is french fries (chips) served inside of a buttered roll. It's hard to look at without laughing but it's an awesome idea. They have a huge selection of draft beers on tap. This place actually has a better menu than the one on Spring Mtn.

5xN-ZGjzT7vgVw6cspxviw.text: I found this place on Yelp! They were SPOT ON!!! The FIsh and Chips are Crunchy, light and Delicious! I always ask for an extra piece of Fish because one is just not enough for me. If you are a Chicken finger lover-you came to the right place! We eat here at least 2X a month!!!

pNDpzetkLPZumf3zRMb2mA.text: Nice place!  I lived in England for a time and developed a taste for British Ales so it is great to find a place that has them on tap here in Vegas.  I had the Sunday dinner special which was excellent.  Bar tenders are friendly.

EHY08ssr5fTiBHdr38E89g.text: I personally don't like the food here but I will give them the benefit of the doubt because there are always tons of Brits eating here and I've never been to Britain. I once saw them do a takeout order of 25 orders of fish and chips for some higher roller at Wynn so that means something to me, too.   So that having been said, it's always lots of fun here especially now during the world cup and you can't beat the $20 video poker free lunch special.   Word of warning, they do have a weird alcohol license where you can only have beer at the bar but beer or alcohol in the dining area. So get your seat at the bar and whenever you want a shot, order from the waitress in the dining area.

FM-zWVksqQ6BpNn7-0Pmuw.text: Our favorite pub in Las Vegas.  Good food, great beer and close to the Strip. Make it a point to go!

j7ZT8ZPg396_dUZ3SMcXdw.text: Crisps with curry gravy and a cider, is the best ever.  Their chicken tenders are the best!  And a salad with beats - love the beats.

-2lEZYq2q7AAHW2r2Uaw6w.text: Food was delicious, Staff was attentive and friendly. Nice themed atmosphere.

arbecbx2p6_zSy6IfaJU3w.text: We were staying at Bluegreen Club 36 which is very near UNLV and loved the idea of going someplace off the Strip.  We went for dinner on a Wednesday night and it was very popular but we didn't have to wait very long.  The food was good - I love Scotch Eggs and also the chicken and leek pie was delicious! Good choice of beer.  Lots of students but we were weren't the only ones there who weren't.  Fun atmosphere, good service. We'd definitely go back again if we ever return to Vegas.

5RmC45UF_3iBxUVQwG3leQ.text: They are sooooo good! They were friendly, out waitress and the bartenders were nice, and they have really good veggie burgers! (Something I was hoping they would have)

x2PZ1yX891LOOK54GXXuYw.text: And again. Stopped by. While on a cycling route. Great patio where I could look after my bike. Service was sub-par. Cocktail waitress was not to be found. Went inside stood at the desk and waited a long time. I was about to give up when the bartender acknowledged me. I then noticed the cocktail waitress was in deep conversation with someone at the bar while I waited. The beef dip was plain. Light in protein. The au-jus was good but too salty. The chips were good. I'll stick with my initial impression. I'll avoid it unless out for a good beer.

7Eztxm9wDSNq1hVgkz71Tw.text: As a British Ex-pat this is the closest thing i have to being home in Vegas.   The food is good, although they do seem to have issues making a decent custard to go with the sticky toffee pudding (come on how difficult is it to boil a kettle and mix in the custard powder until it's smooooooooth!!!) anyhoo the atmosphere is authentic, right down to the slightly stinky toilets (a staple in any British pub!) and the chalk boards (so you can write humorous japes to your mates!)   The beer is good and plentiful; although they did run out of St George Ale just before St Georges day (that's what i call bad planning!) and the selection covers most of the known world; why they even have some luke warm gnats piss that the yanks know as beer! (Lol I'm gonna get lunched now!! ;p )   The best thing is on Mondays they do ALL YOU CAN EAT FISH AND CHIPS, OK so it doesn't come with mushy peas, but it's a damn good representation of the dish, and they do use cod (none of that haddock b@llocks here my friends.)   The appetisers are a little odd, sausage roll, chip butty and scotch eggs to name a few; for those of you who think this is standard faire will be sadly mistaken. A scotch egg and sausage roll is used for picnicking and the chip butty is a cheap student dinner. A True British appetiser or starter is...prawn cocktail with Marie rose sauce, Heinz cream of tomato soup, stuffed garlic mushrooms and pate on toast (not all together of course!!), the main dishes are more authentic, i can recommend the steak and mushroom pie and the roast dinner on Sundays ONLY!!  There's not much else to say about this place; apart from their world cup coverage was super and they served $4 pints of Stella!!   Wankers away my friends, wankers away!

FdTi161zmOXA-43qkrCtpQ.text: one of the places I truly enjoy drinking and eating. the staff is always chill and nice. and if this is as close as what I can get to British Pub food hey sounds dope to me.

pLqyoVAX1bV2vZHyPDhZuw.text: Beer! It's my favorite, and Crown & Anchor has a great selection.  Having British grandparents, and a father and uncle who grew up in England, a place like this just feels right.  Fish and Chips are tasty, as well as Cornish pasties!  But I love the giant Yorkshire pudding!  We always had Yorkshire for our Sunday roast beef dinners, and this one taste just like the family recipe. I love the layout, and the outdoor seating option, but I prefer sitting in the bar, near the dart boards, where I can find soccer or rugby on one of the tvs!  Its a great place to gather :)

BsX6KKKXHWBxEk_TFY-nAw.text: Crown.  Anchor.  Either one by itself would be sufficient for excellent dining.  But you put them both together and you get:  1. Bartenders/waitresses with kilts and knee highs.  Damn. 2. The scotch egg (!) which is a hard boiled egg wrapped in sausage.  Shit yeah. 3. English soccer, and, better yet, english soccer fans at 430 in the morning on saturday singing and chanting to their teams.  The food is pretty decent but I have to tell you that there's more, like the huge beer selection and did I mention hot waitresses with kilts and knee highs?  Go there when a live soccer game is playing and there will be a crowd and a cover, even at 3 or 4 in the morning.  I shit you not.

yzqqZEBsHd2or86eszodgQ.text: My parents took us out for great fish and chips when I was a kid, for the past 40 years I've tried everywhere to find good fish and chips and am always sorely disappointed (my partner is under orders to stop me from ordering fish and chips because it's usually so bad).  FINALLY!  The Fish & Chips at the Crown & Anchor are better than my childhood memories!  The food was so good, I actually ate peas - and enjoyed it.  This place is fantastic.  Everything was great, real food and dog friendly on the patio,  What more could you want, I've found happiness.

GitvvC-QsFrl-p6nbyO1SA.text: Cool sports hang-out place for those near UNLV. Before Yardhouse and Freakin' Frogs, you came here for your beers. Hell, you can still come here for your beers. I want to say they have 60 beers on tap that you can try. They give you a special card too, that they punch for you every time you try a new beer. If you get through all of them, they give you a prize. I don't know what the prize is, since I don't know anyone who has made it through all the beers.   Its a fun looking place too. It looks like a small cottage from the outside, but its a fun place clean place on the inside. It isn't a dive bar by no means. I have never been to an authentic British pub, but I could imagine that they look like the Crown & Anchor..

yHA0ykO5NaJg3BwzhYiGJQ.text: Cute atmosphere, horrible service. We sat down at a table and waited 25 minutes. We were never acknowledged even though the waitress sat down at the table next to us and had a conversation with the party. She came and went at least 3 times and never stopped to ask if we had been helped.

jVLjOBBGCAbVZFYMMX4cZA.text: Yelp came thru once again... I arrived on a late flight and had not had dinner so we decided to look for a place close by to eat and this popped up.  The place was pretty empty around 9pm but shortly filled up for trivia night.  I had a side salad and order of wings and my husband had the fish and chips.  And we also had a couple pints, they have 30 draft choices!  The wings and sauce were superb, the wings are battered but its light not overpowering, the sauce is on the side and just how we love it vinegar and spice.  My husband raved about the fish, I didn't try it.  The fries/chips were good, thick cut awesome with malt vinegar.  My big gripe here is that its a bar and I guess in Vegas they still let you smoke, yuck!  Anyways if in the area I would go back again for the awesome wings.   P.S.  We tried the sticky toffee pudding and it was not good, super dry and no ice cream.  If you want one that will knock your socks off try it at Gallagher's restaurant at NY-NY hotel.  Theirs is awesome.

yIubF3argSruah1VK24EWg.text: We went for the fish and chips tonight.Was our first visit.We couldn't help noticing that the place could use a good cleaning.The fish tasted ok,but we were not blown away by it.Portion was small.Chips were good,peas undercooked.Server girls were nice,seated us and brought our drink orders fast.Village Pub fish and chips portion is larger,tastes better for less $.We still might return to check out some other menu items,they sound interesting.Free lunch for 20 in play sounds good.

qvN4E4IUpFuo1eMARvJh6Q.text: Its a great pub themed bar with really good food. They are local friendly. I'd recommend it.

cPnmjC3O_4StOZg-THZ_LA.text: June and Ron are such amazing people! June's smile melts your heart! Sit with Leslie at the bar she's beautiful inside and out she'll make you feel right at home. The restaurant is a cozy, warm comfy feel at home British Pub. It's pet friendly if you sit outside in the patio and It's so fun to people watch. Monday night's there's all you can eat Fish and Chip's YUM! There's also foosball and a pool table upstairs. We'll definitely be returning. Love this place!

h6OXEw5Lhiz7A0cuEQGMKw.text: Arriving here with some friends and relieved I could get off the Strip to some local destinations, I entered a very divey smoke-filled bar. Parking was easy. One portion was a sit down area, while the other area was legitimately a bar with booze, cigarettes, and televisions a plenty.   My friends and I were quickly seated and waited upon by a incredibly friendly staff. Considering it was a Thursday night, we anticipated a heavy college crowd, but were surprised to find it half-full. After a round of drinks, dinner was ordered. My selection was the chicken curry. I ordered as-is and found the dish to be quite kicking. The medium-sized chicken cuts were doused with a thin yellow sauce. The sauce is what made the dish kick. Unable to figure out whether what made it kick outside of any curry taste, I was baffled and prayed that my stomach wouldn't hurt later. It didn't. The dish, while seemingly small for the famished, ended up being very filling. Complemented by chicken tenders, I was very full and quite happy.   Consider this place if you're bored and want to get out of Vegas, and have a dinner with the locals. Without all the shiny, materialistic, commercialized stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fingers
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry

SJ-d-89rlhe0oxUNzTLyMg.text: The Crown and Anchor has been my go to bar for years. My CO workers and I come here often on Wednesday since they offer a free beer to those in the healthcare industry as long as you come in wearing your work scrubs. They also have a graveyard menu, great for when you had a night out and wish to have a meal before heading home. To top it off the Crown and anchor also has a dog friendly patio which is perfect for breakfast on a Sunday morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

It-CrDQ4H3P7yGP7lhzEBA.text: This review is for 3.5 stars.  This is a nice British pub.  I came here on a friday night to enjoy some beer and play some darts with some coworkers.  As far as a bar goes, it is pretty large and has a quality selection of import brews.  There is a jukebox that has some great music available as well.  Come here if you just want to chill near the strip.  The beers are not cheap by any means ($6-$8), but you can still have a good time nonetheless.    The biggest thing about this bar is that they do not show prices on their beer menu.  This is one of my biggest pet peeves and really irritates me.  None of the beers are over $8 (I believe), but this always grinds my gears when it comes to bars.

IgX_7wLhYY0X2VNHdgY3Rw.text: What can i say? I really love this place. My go to place for champions league. Food is great and service is amazing. Been here multiple times and I always leave satisfied. Definitely recommend their bangers. Their selection of alcohol is pretty good as well. Price isn't bad and it is never crowded around lunch time so you have the place to yourself when watching your favorite team.

1bPd8n4wKa-EWSFRzd0DqA.text: Nice, Friendly bar tender. Stopped in for late lunch and a few pints.  Downside "smokers" :(

QpNzMJT85XsgsCN3i5NjNg.text: I liked this place. We wanted a proper British-style roast dinner for Easter and this fit the bill. We got there just after noon on Sunday and had the place to ourselves (I know, we are bad people to go to a bar on Easter, but it is Vegas, so...).  The food was pretty good, although the lamb was very fatty and the beef was a bit overcooked. The veggies (peas and carrots) were cooked very well. Hot but slightly crunchy - no overbuild mush here. The mashed potatoes were real and the gravy was brown and rich. I question whether we got yorkshire pudding or a popover as it didn't have any beef flavoring, which was expected based on how it should be cooked. Regardless, it was pretty tasty.  I know several reviewers complained about the service, but we had no problem at all. Sure, we were in an empty bar, but I can't discount the service we got because of that. If I had any complaint about the place is that it had a bit of a grimy (not well cleaned) feel to it. Again though, I bet if the other bars we frequented in Vegas were brightly lit I am sure I would have felt the same.   I would certainly come back here again as they had great beers on tap and their prices were great.  Reply to Richard: I am from ND but get to Vegas a few times a year. Next time you can buy me a pint and I will repay the favor.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday lamb roast dinner.

TLaGqlVSdzr0lowqrq2ahg.text: This is my favorite British Pub in Vegas. It's a little, dingy, dive bar that serves authentic British Pub food. Fish and chips, bangers ND mash, and my personal favorite, Ploughman's Plate with Stilton cheese and Bread pickle. It is as close to Shakespeare's near the Airport in San Diego. That is where I was introduced to Boddington's ale!  Soccer is on the TV daily.

PN03CRT5CUmsS1frIP998A.text: I have eaten at this place many times over the years and always been happy with the food and the service. However, we visited a couple of weeks ago on a Sunday morning hoping to eat a stunning "full monty". Sadly we were disappointed as the server was not only inattentive ( she seemed to be consumed with flirting with a customer at the bar) but when we complained about her poor service she was extremely rude so we decided to leave and eat elsewhere. Sad to see that the standards have dropped so far at a place that I had always held up as a good place to eat. We will not patronize this pub again.

ve8Bds5RGJj62-GJhvggUQ.text: I have been going into this restaurant for about 11 years. I've seen quality food and service go up and down through the years. All in all not a bad place were I chose to take my wife tonight for our anniversary. What a mistake bear in mind it wasn't the servers fault, you could tell he was working beneath his skills at this restaurant. Oh my God my wife is throwing up and I can't stay out of the bathroom. If the cook was standing in front of me I'd punch him in the face myself. Old freezer burnt terrible food was presented to us. The only thing I'm good there was the fish. Nasty condiments that had not been cleaned or replaced in years. My peas we're mix between brown and black and wrinkled like raisins. The salad was by no means fresh. Let me correct myself their iced tea was pretty good. We had no alcoholic beverages. But the fact that my wife threw up at the entry to our home, and that I within an hour of eating I can't stay out of the bathroom. Makes me wonder what else is wrong with the food and or condiments. Stay away just nasty. The owner oughta be ashamed of himself. And the cook I want to meet him or her personally.

XMwJ8ZPpxk_jqiscm26wzA.text: I love this local bar  I won the Halloween contest!  They love me there!  Adam the bartender is so fun and nice!  It's only good at night  In the day it's weird with English tourists and quiet The food is good.  Love their scotch egg and fish n chips  They have salads   I even had a catered birthday party here.  My friends liked it.  Nice to watch "football" games .

nU-Kgm2DR1bOYQcQsuIhyg.text: This my favorite place for beer, burger or both. They always a soccer game on which was the whole reason I started going in the first place. I recommend the fish and chips, the best!

FyAkliOPZ8hFCJH8ywFVqg.text: Watched World Cup here.  James was great.  He's sweet and nice and really took care of us.  There were lots of people but he always found us and made sure we got what we needed.  Thanks James!

dl3NqTdb4ebjB_dev-tsfg.text: This is my favorite chicken finger and beer spot!!! Kara is my favorite waitress here who is always great with service and attentive.   Crown and anchors food is phenomenal for great prices. I love their interesting selection of stews, their burgers, and their chicken fingers are to die for!!! I also love how they always have soccer streaming on all the televisions.  I recommend their Guinness and pear cider drink. Their drinks are awesome and all the bar tenders are nice! I highly recommend this pub :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger :)
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb stew

biyjJjT4Wp4Q9TlYHB-3Yg.text: My only gripe was not the food at all but the amount of the food has decreased over the years since i first started going there. On the dish is use to be alot of food but the last few times i been there its very little and was ready to eat again in less then an hour later.

v7hw_Hd4p2gfqqYDxPbGqw.text: I gave this restaurant only two stars.  The food is mediocre and under seasoned. The Yorkshire pudding, although gigantic, need some salt in the batter.  The tea service that was brought to the table was dirty and we asked for another.  The tablecloth was also sticky.  They need to clean a little more.  All in all....not the greatest experience we have had.  Dirty restaurant.

NcKUo6gUZIzDzfyRV06uJw.text: Best "British" food in Vegas. I was so surprised that there was not a big crowd. The food was great. Monday night is "all you can eat" fish. There was some British guys at the table next to ours and it was awesome to talk about the UK and where we are from. The waitresses kept our plates full and drinks refilled. I will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K4Zm2KvhLOCUFlwhTZOPYQ.text: Great English pub! You feel like your in  Europe. The fish and chips are some of the best in town. The steak and mushroom pie is very flavorful. Service has been good and attentive. We like to stop before Rebel and VGK games when in the area.

b3DwlLbHAJUK7dItCkxBFA.text: I'm American, but I lived in the U.K. for 8 years during the 1990s, and I must say that THIS is the best British pub - both in ambience and in genuiness of food - that I have found, or probably ever will find in the States.  I've tried the scotch egg, sausage roll and fish and chips when I have gone there (3 times, so far), and they are spot on - none of this fake "We'll CALL it a pub and give the silly Yanks what they *think* is "British" food, which is really just American food" mentality of so many pseudo English/Irish/whateverish "pubs" - this is the real deal - or as real as customs will allow.  You must try the fish and chips - get them with mushy peas, because that's good!  The other thing I've loved about this pub is that you never see any kids there - as a child-free person, this is refreshing and so much more enjoyable than wondering if little Bratleigh will yell, scream, cry, run around and basically ruin everyone else's dinner - Bratleigh's somewhere else - GOD SAVE THE QUEEN!!!  And you immigrated Brits now living over here - you'll love this place!

zw6U-SGN9I2u0ARUpc3a4Q.text: If you want to catch a premier league game or drink all day, i highly recommend this location. The world cup starts in 7 months. If you are in vegas and considering where to watch the games, do not hesitate, this place will be amazing. The fans are very much into their teams and will cheer them on the entire match.

Uly5mpeHPldmHz_F3FIZoA.text: This place is the closest Las Vegas will get to a college bar. The place is modeled after an English pub situated in a large wooden hall. They have a variety of beers on tap and after you've had them all (all 30), they'll give you some kind of Crown and Anchor swag.   Thought it was kinda weird that the place was filled with seats. In other cities, a type of bar like this would also double as a club haha. That wouldn't fly in Vegas I suppose.  If you're a local and looking for a chill time with a very young and college scene, come here. No grimy old man pedos.   If you're a tourist and you've ventured this far from the strip, you'll find this place a comforting and unpretentious bar to pass the time.  Minus one star for the service which is also very collegy.

RH_VYY82eo_UkQvcad2yag.text: My husband and I were visiting Las Vegas for a week to check out moving there. We wanted to get a feel of the land and what it offered, if we moved there.    My husband is of Scottish heritage and wanted to check out British pubs. I found the Crown and Anchor on Tropicana Ave. Reckon we struck solid gold!!!!!!     It was everything we could have wanted from the atmosphere to the pub grub. I had always wanted to try the Yorkshire pudding and was very happy to see it on the menu and with 2 sides of sauces no less! We were so satisfied, we returned again later that week! A regular haunt if we do move there.    The wait staff were fantastically nice and helpful. Our server was Tracy, and she was great! The prices were very good for the quality and portions of the food. We tried many sides, the stuffed potato skins, the fish and chips, the stilton cheese platter, the yorkshire pudding and kept looking at what others around us were ordering.  They have quite a large pub food menu to choose from.    We sat next to four people visiting from England, and they said they loved it and  had been there countless times before, when visiting Las Vegas. It WILL definitely be one of our favorite pub/restaurants in Las Vegas! It being one of two there, can't wait to visit the other one on the west side.

EwIdWYJpzgEZ4uhmRdT22A.text: Good food. Fish and chips were great. 2 issues. Fish pieces were too big and they put the veggies on the same plate as the fish and chips, so everything got soggy. Great server - Lauren. Would come back again.

gT-MHT2J_racNX6WlCYzow.text: Meh... It's really dark so it makes me suspicious of the food. I remember liking this place... but perhaps I was just drunk. Went there today with some friends to eat dinner and shoot some darts. No flights on any of the darts... so bring your own. The food was too greasy, too much cumin spice and the potatoes where cold, gravy tasted like brown envelope gravy and the peas where cold. I really wish they had good food because I really like the pasties crust. The severs are nice, but the wait time for food was long. Probably not going to come here again. Going to find a better pub for pasties.

KANCKZ-nF3Z7MwxocUinpw.text: Was not impressed at all.  The female bartender was nice but the male bartender was a dick.  I ordered a sandwich from the female bartender and 2 minutes later I hear the male bartender talking shit about what I ordered to other guys sitting at the bar (who he didn't seem to be friends with, and for the record, what business is it of theirs?).  Then he came over and said something about ordering the same thing his grandmother ate.  Wow, your g-ma eats chicken too?  What are the odds?  I went here because I was looking to watch a soccer game and another bar by my house recommened it.    I need to find a different soccer friendly bar somewhere in this city because I will not return here.

agk6Ioo23kz9LArWOfXQOA.text: My regular Las Vegas pub. Bartenders and servers are all awesome. I watch all of my Epl matches here. I've met Some of the craziest premier league fans in my life at this bar. The beer selection is amazing. I recommend trying them all and filling out a crown card. Once the card is all filled out the bar gives you a free t shirt. . Also, the chicken strips the best in town. Haven't found better yet.

3ZKzdrZ0-QtGxyBUIB4eCw.text: I recently started going to Crown & Anchor because of a suggestion from a friend. We usually go to the one on Spring Mtn, but this one is closer to my house. For a Friday night around 10pm, this place was moderately packed.  Let me start off by saying that THE ONLY REASON I come to Crown & Anchor is because of the Snakebite. I would come here everyday if I could for this  damn drink. I never in my life had liked beer so much until I found this tasty delight. Both locations have darts which is always a fun activity to do with a group of people too. A friend of mine also ordered this dish that included Home Made Potato Chips which were a hit at our table.  I can't say better things about Crown and Anchor. A+ to them.

IGpMdWwmNVtUmkdT1olDxQ.text: Really enjoyed myself here! The staff were very polite and on top of there game. The place was filled with a bunch of people drinking beer and eating food. The wings were pretty good, and the beer prices were reasonable. I would come back for sure.

aZRBBIxBeJZIPuVCRh4XKg.text: There seems to be some kind of misconception, I believe, that British food is "bland," or otherwise lacking in flavor.  While that may be True in the UK, it certainly isn't the case, here.  I don't get over to this place as much as I would like, and that's MY loss, because every time I dine here, I'm never disappointed.  In fact, a fraternal/social group to which I belong, used to meet here every Friday night, about 10+ years ago.  We had most of the upstairs section to ourselves.  I can recommend almost everything on the menu, as at one time or another, I've sampled most of the fare offered.  I treated a total of 5 of my good friends there on June 13, 2012, and the total price for all 6 of us was under $100, so their charges are certainly reasonable.  But best of all, if I may be permtted a totally MALE observation, I definitely noticed the delightfully (and incredibly) SHORT Scottish kilts being worn by the female servers.  No joking guys, they all have LEGS TO DIE FOR.

hzaDefjwsOCmo_dwQfBqow.text: The hard cider selection once included Woodpecker.. And now they have a small selection of ciders. I enjoy playing some darts, having a couple ciders, I love the bangers on a bun with grilled onions and the waitresses all wear cute tartan skirts

19gyPn5RDUgCoQ_F7ndWsQ.text: Not the place it used to be. It has turned into a "bro" bar. Now it's a college bar, which makes sense for the location. Still, it used to be better. So sad.

NVdd8JhwXwRCTy4fRa7TZQ.text: I've lived in Vegas for 9 years. For some reason, I had not made it over here until recently. I've been to most of the well known dive bars and pubs around town. This place has a solid beer selection. The staff is very friendly. Adam is very cool and makes you feel nice and relaxed. The vibe is always upbeat and chill. The food is very tasty! If I had to complain about anything(it's a small one)...it would be the need for a few more upper end craft beers. They have a solid selection...but with the addition of a few more Belgians or sours and it would be great!

vGG4q31bUJstNtuLc0yWZQ.text: Don't go for the food. Looks like it would be a decent drinking place. Hardly any TV's around to watch sports. Went out of our way to go and was disappointed. From my visit, not bad, just average I'm afraid

O1js905LM7GpyLSeeUhPkg.text: Went here for dinner on our first night in Vegas.  It's a little restaurant off the strip and being an ex-pat I am always down for some tasty (read greasy) British grub.  They had a lot of comfort food that I remember from my youth.  Couldn't make up my mind on an app so I tried a Sausage roll and a Yorkshire Pudding.  The latter was very dry as if it had been cooked a few days ago and just warmed up.  I had a Blackthorn draft with Blackcurrent (originally asked for Ribena, but waitress had no idea what this was).  Can't remember exactly what my buddy ordered, I think it was some sort of stew.  I went with a Banger buddy (sausage sandwich) with chips.  All in all, not bad.  I wouldn't be rushing back here any time soon.  As a plus we were entertained by the two LVPD police officers who were dining next to us.  It was literally something out of Reno 911 as these two argued over the fact that one of them had never tried clam chowder and the other one was forcing him to sample from the bowl that he had ordered.

5WHCY5i3tG3bcLLJA7tDGA.text: I know this is probably heresy but I have one word to sum up the crown and anchor: Meh.  I think to enjoy this place you need to be  A) in college and B) have never been to any other pub. Ever.  First off, I expect a pub to serve more than just beer and wine at the bar. To get hard alcohol (ie. Whiskey in my case) you have to sit in the dining area and order food.  Someone cheaped out on a real liquor license and just doesn't care at this point.  Second, the fish + chips I've tried twice here and its completely lackluster. Not worth the hype. It tastes frozen. The chips were mealy, both times. Very middle of the road. Maybe they had a better chef or food distributor a while back when it got voted #1 in Vegas, but there's far better elsewhere.  The jukebox was a little bit crap too. I heard the Police greatest hits for a little too long. Then it was followed by 1990's euro trash techno. Very blah.  On the upside: great atmosphere, great room, nice pool tables. If you're a major beer drinker, then you'll love it. The whiskey drinker in me was disappointed by their liquor policy.

eAJ09P1CFaGGZUu7kmLuUQ.text: Best British food in Vegas. I use to live in Britain so I know what is good and not. Nice servers and very authentic food.

wJtFee_0wAES0LdOncQvsA.text: My wife and I were on vaca in Vegas and after touring the atomic testing museum we wanted to eat somewhere not in a casino nav system in car offered this place way to go my wife loved the fish and chips and my steak and kidney pie was great but best of all was chocolate bread pudding server was busy but friendly and attentive wish it wasn't a 5 hour flight to come back

72Vmwj7cnCdyfbp56xkouA.text: Brought my wife here for lunch, the waitress looked at us and walked by us three times and made eye.contact each time (Erica) and finally I had to loudly call out "excuse me ms.!" To get her attention. After we got our orders my meat and liver pie was great however everything else was terrible. The chicken was drie the mashed potatoes were dry, the peas werent thoroughly cooked and the service continued to be less than even average... I doubt Ill ever convince my wife to come here again...

IdU5WB-SF4GepD2yFEfIKQ.text: As a frequenter of Vegas, this is easily the best local bar in the whole town. I love starting/ending my nights here. With a great selection of beer and a surprisingly tasty menu, I can't get enough of this place. The bartenders are awesome and definitely take care of you. The regulars are friendly. Having not grown up in Vegas and my parents moving there 7 years ago when I was 18, I didn't have any friends when I go to visit them until I discovered Crown & Anchor. My first night there I walked in by myself and met some new friends and a few girls and ended up staying until 10AM full of shots. Awesome time every time. As many times as I try other places, I always just come right back to C&A.

57ujS12ikD1k2fORC6XYVQ.text: I am sorry, but I sooooo wanted to like this place.  I mean, what's not to like?  It's a kitschy little bit o'Britain right on Tropicana in the middle of the freaking desert, how can you not like that?  Well, let's just say we stopped by their this afternoon for a wee bit o'food coming back from McCarran and oh my was I disappointed.    Now, there is no doubt they have an excellent selection of draught beers and I quite enjoyed my Belgian wheat beer, but sad to say, the Mrs, had an ice tea and she had to get a Sprite, because the tea tasted like water, yuck!  Anyway on to the food.  Again like another poster mentioned, the fish & chips were just kind of sad.  I mean here we are sitting in the middle of supposedly  Her Majesty's finest establishment expecting British excellence and the fish seemed like something that had been bought at a Costco.    OK, you are right, this is the middle of the Mojave Desert and there ain't no friggin' ocean anywhere near here, but come on, I have had better frozen fish at lots of places that are far from the sea.  Now on to my Ploughman's Lunch.  Oh, how I do like a Ploughman's plate, and to tell the truth they did do a wee bit better here than they do with the fish.  But the bread was dry and almost stale, and  the cheddar cheese tasted like something you'd buy at a supermarket.  Now the Stilton was a nice piece of cheese, though not the best bleu cheese I have had but not the worst either.  The tomato was fresh, but I was a bit expecting the beets to be pickled but they were just cold cooked beat slices.  Service was fine, though nothing spectacular.  The young lass who served us did a good job, but she didn't provide excellent service, it was just kind of a step above adequate.  Again, I really wanted to like the place.  The atmosphere is cool in a corny kind of a way.  I am fond of kitsch, but if you are going for kitsch you also have to provide more than a semi cozy English pub type environment.  You also need to have food that is going to live up to the hype, sadly the Crown & Anchor had the sizzle, but no steak.

3zYIkjhlErddCgaMPP-j1Q.text: Don't know if they got new cooks or what but fish and chips came out cold and my burger came out missing top bun... Haven't been here in 2 months but food taste different

iA--NSiO7bEvMgyoylTulA.text: Reasons I like the Crown: Late-night Hangin on the patio with a Guinness (or two) Outstanding Fish and Chips (with Peas!) Sticky Toffee Pudding (with custard on top if you ask nicely) The Chip Butty (which I've never ordered, but just love the idea of butter-covered french fries on a hamburger bun)  Things I don't like: Service is never what you'd call 'brisk' The place could use a bit of a scrub Patrons can be surly on game nights. But what do ya want? It's a pub, right?  The perfect place to end a long evening on a warm spring night.

F8FQii-ClN6Qb7Kq7BqHgQ.text: Love the ambience, beer selection is great and the food is tasty. Just far enough off the strip to get away from all the tourists.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;ve wanted try one of these since seeing on The Layover. Tasty.

rKb21UazBGvUERd73YvRWA.text: The pub is pretty typical, but the food is outstanding! One thing I like is that they don't try to over do the "English" pub thing...   The decor is themed, but it's not overboard.

CJtysdD4yQZckuECZo3_OQ.text: The burly bartender comped me a free drink because I came inside sick! Horrays!  Until I came here I was giving up on looking for a legitimate UNLV Student hangout. I had the assumption that outside of campus, they either split up to do their own thing or went to Frat and Sorority parties instead.   Almost half the people inside are attending, attended, or will attend UNLV. It's great to hang out with people my age.   Also the atmosphere is somewhat divey, however, not bummish! It is however, British, and it is LEGITIMATELY British because they serve ales that, according to my older brother, is primarily served as favorites in the United Kingdom such as Hoegaarden.   Havn't heard that one have you? Hoegaarden is the predecessor of Blue Moon and dates back by 600 years. It's Belgian White production was restarted in the middle of the 20th Century.   My brother is coming back with his overseas coworkers from the U.K. and he is definitely bringing all of them over here!

y9RGkpiX-FdgHCUlx-ccMA.text: Wonderful place for a drink. Four ciders on tap. If you wear your scrubs on Wednesday you get a first free beer and discounts.

xkXiNEL96Fqxas6PQ-tC5Q.text: Finally! Some decent beers on tap! Odd that you can only drink beer at the bar; cocktails are allowed in the dining areas. Attentive staff. Good goth music the night I was there. Really near the Pinball Hall of Fame.

nZSB2JTP0Ep3biP8ufi2IA.text: This review is based more on the service rather than the food or atmosphere , we had a large group of people meeting for a going away party , and basically were just left hanging around , we had to move tables for ourselves , and when server did come by it was rushed !! I realize it's a busy place but if they know it's going to be busy shouldn't they staff more ? For those that ordered food the wait to get it was over an hour , seriously about an hour and 15 minutes !! Our server was argumentative , when we asked what the hold up was , and basically said " do you want it or not ? Half the group cancelled their orders , the others starved , decided to wait even longer for food that was mediocre at best , The beer selection was nice and I'm sure we would have spent more ( there were some drinkers in the group that just went to bar for their cocktails ) but with no one coming by often to check for empty cocktails I only had about 2 drinks in about 2 and half hours ( usually could have doubled that , lol ) after leaving there I went to a real bar and was served promptly , all in all though there was nothing here that would make me want to come back !!

1qtD6lmev0_qT-7RUfNM7A.text: Get past the crowd of UNLV students, or just come during the off-hours of their typical hours of drinking, and overlook the often slow service.  Do these things and you will enjoy Crown & Anchor for what it is... an actual traditional British Pub in Las Vegas. I will be the first to admit I have never been to a real British pub, like say, in London, but hey if this is the closest I can get right now, so be it.   I suggest Fish and Chips and it is typically what I get when I come here, although I have had a few other selections, this is certainly my go to and it's good, EVERY TIME.It's fish, it's chips, it comes with great tartar sauce if you want it.   Not to mention the beer selection. It's works for me. I think everyone should come here at least once.

WIo4G69Smbaq1E-hyfsnqg.text: Last time I was here was back in 93, hasn't changed much and neither has the fish n chips...outstanding as usual. I grew in the UK and familiar with pubs, this feels like home.

lvao0FI7CD7Ayl6RoZlKYA.text: Looking for dinner while on a business trip. sort of lost, saw this place and stopped out of aggrivation. Small and quaint beer and dart bar with a great British menu. Server (Sarah) was very nice and the food was delicious. Get the meat mushroom pie. Came with whipped mashed potatoes and veggies. Plenty of beers to chose from. Outside is run down, but inside is clean and nice. Got lucky here.

LRJ6Y8yem1pd45E6DJXo8w.text: I have been to Crown & Anchor a few times with friends.  I guess I'm just far too old to be drawn into the hype, but I was not impressed.  Perhaps if you just celebrated your 21st birthday and you want to get smashed, this is a good place for you.  I'm not that person, so I just find the droves of college kids annoying.    I didn't take away stars for that preference, though.  I took away stars for the food.  What is everyone so hung up on here?  I've done the whole fish & chips thing plenty of times in my life, and this doesn't even rate with me.  I agree with a previous poster who said that the fish just seemed like it was frozen.  I wasn't that into it.  I guess I'm nuts, because a lot of people swear by the fish here.  However, I've had better.  I've had WAAAAAAY better in other cities, and I've even had better here in Vegas.    The service is slow if you order food.  I do enjoy sitting outside on the patio, but if I'm paying to eat something, I don't wanna feel like I basically paid for the ambiance.

UWdqn5ieHL92FUWnOWUqog.text: I had lunch here with work folks. Had the bangers and mash and they had fish and chips. Was good with decent service. Only wish I had a beer to wash it down but maybe next time. Noticed several customers with a British accent so that was a good sign.

AjDEXKRoyqyN1WeN30qg5A.text: I LITERALLY almost cried of anger after leaving this place the last time I was here. Mind you, it was sometime ago but I pray to the almighty savior of the universe that the bartender who "assisted" us no longer works here. Tall, dirty blonde, blue eyed a**hole was our bartender. Didn't catch his name, was literally too shocked to think. Let's just say I've NEVER not tipped EVER. I work in this industry, I know we all live off of tipping but it's called tip service for a reason & there was none to be had here. I grew up in Vegas: I was always taught that if you're a gamer & you're gaming quite a bit at least a few comped drinks (in this case beer cause they don't serve liquor @ the bar) is pretty standard. Nope! Not to tall, dirty blonde, blue eyed a**hole. He told me "I decide what gets comped!!" with his finger pointed @ my face after I simply asked why he had charged ME for my best friends drinks when she was playing. My night ended @ PT's sad to say. Never again Crown & Anchor.

lY69C90-ZirTA7D3TtTmfA.text: Things I like about the Crown & Anchor: The location (off the strip, but not too far off, close enough to walk to Thomas & Mack for bball games) The beer selection (Chimay on tap is pretty rare in LV) They have darts and a jukebox.  Things that are just ok: The parking situation (not too many spots, especially tight on game day, you usually have to park at the paint store or the llantera and hope you don't get towed). The food (burgers and fish & chips are decent) The prices (reasonable, but I wish happy hour went past 6) The ambiance (pub-ish) The service (sometimes good, sometimes slow)  Thing I hate: The smoking! (yes, they still allow it!)

14p1WtCPkFjITHwdDnBYzA.text: After hearing all the craze about their fabulous chicken wings, I had to come and try it out for myself!  Lucky me, even though I'm not a beer drinker, my Vegas go to man was willing to drag me along so I can indulge in some much needed deep fried crunch!  I can attest that yes, indeed, these chicken wings and drumettes are big ole things.  There's a lot of batter and meat on these babies, but I couldn't say so much for the taste itself.  Because we were dousing it in ranch dressing and hot sauce, of course it tasted fabulous.  But take away all of that, and I wasn't so sure there was so much flavor in the chicken or batter itself.  Bummer.  They do a fine job though giving it to you on the crispy crunchy end, and we like crispy crunchy things!   They do have a pretty extensive beer on tap selection, which is always impressive.  I'm a pear cider kind of girl for now...  They have various specials from late night craving deals to specialties of the day.  And who doesn't love a place that's open 24 hours?  I'm on a mission to find tastier chicken wings that this!  Bring it!  Update! 10/08/07 - I'm 1/3 of the way through my "Down The Hatch!" card!  Yay!  What the heck is that?!  They have this frequent beer drinker card and when you drink 30 of their beers, you get a free gift.  The BF is on card #3 already and is a proud owner of a Crown and Anchor T-shirt and Crown and Anchor soccer shirt.  (I'm hoping for the baby doll tee myself.)  They have some cool bartenders working here and a pool table upstairs as well.  We brought out of town guests and they loved the place!  I think they had live music the past Saturday.  We got there a bit too late and saw them putting their equipment away.  Yay for live music! And there's all you can eat fish and chips on Monday nights and happy hours from 3 pm to 6 pm!  Another cool thing is that they are showing football (soccer) games on the TV, and if you come by really late at night, they'll still have games on!  Sidenote:  They even offer a free shuttle pickup service! Wow!

vqW9uH8Iiw5FloTD88ynsA.text: Have yet to try anything off the menu, but I love coming here just for the atmosphere. Great place to end a date or night out with friends. Service is friendly and the whole place is very casual and laid back. Worth a stop if you're over on that side of town.

dDl6vIbQf3W4vME_zlRyPg.text: All I can say is Love this place. Been coming for awhile for the Ol'Speckeled Hen on Nitro. New to yelp so I figured I would give a shout to a truly great pub they deserve it. Great Fare! English pub food Scotch Eggs kidney pie. Leslie is a great Bartender friendly hospitable and super on it. Over all Crown is worth the trip and if  Soccer or Rugby is your gig its a must...Slainte!!!

FHQnbGl0uKbAhn9CrFaNKQ.text: Great food and an outdoor patio that's dog friendly.

1ySbPVHUKw2yuziuS_eVWA.text: Crown And Anchor. How do I love thee? Let me count the ways...  This place is a unique establishment, which, in Las Vegas, is an achievement. This place has so many draws. For example, the food is absolutely authentic British pub fare. It's the best in town.   The staff. What can I say? From the plaid skirts to the flirty service, the help is definitely easy on the eyes. And ladies, don't despair, because every male bartender is huge ( I believe a prerequisite for male employment is the ability to bench a Volkswagen).   Crown and Anchor issues to its patrons a challenge. Whosoever can drink all 30 beers available on tap will receive a free Crown and Anchor T shirt in commemoration of their drunken prowess. It repeats up to four times for different swag.   And did I mention Pub Quiz?    Once weekly, on Thursday evenings, teams compete in an impossibly difficult trivia challenge, wherein teams are asked ten very difficult questions, spanning a breadth of topics. Thehighest scoring team receives a 50 dollar bar tab to be used at their next visit. It's competitive, free, and a blast. Highly recommended.   So should you ever get the hankering for English culture for a moderate price, a great view, and some stiff competition, the Crown and Anchor Pub is the place to be.

EW4V8sQOZpzWBqVh08CJyA.text: This was our first time here so we were not sure what to order. Magdalena, the bar tender, was very helpful in helping us with a drink selection and food. I had the Scottish egg which she suggested. I had never had it much less heard of it but it was delicious! Will come again just for the ambiance, the food and selection of beer! Thanks Chris and Magdalena! Until next time. Cheers!

HL2FBSteevbopuJOu8ySfw.text: We used Uber Eats to order a meal while in Las Vegas. The meal was fantastic. Lamb Stew with Yorkshire pudding, Turkey Club and Scotch Eggs. First time to try Scotch Eggs and I would highly recommend them.

cJMMmJNtX6vj5M_MqhEfzw.text: Absolutely the worst place I've been. No one was friendly, they stole money from me and I was sitting at the bar for a good 20 minutes before anyone even asked if I wanted a drink, which you're not allowed to walk around with liquor, only beer. I will never go to this place ever again. *Yes they stole from me. It wasn't much but I literally watched her put my change in her pocket.

zpTC6eP9X3urrhRI2PpgZg.text: My friends and I had lunch here yesterday for the first time ever.  Some very interesting English items on the menu and some I've never had before. Let's start with the pasty that one of the diners had. I can't comment truthfully on this because the pasties that I've had all my life living in Michigan are made differently but these were still good. So I'm just partial to the different way of making them.  Have to admit they were large and well-made with a generous amount of mashed potatoes and brown gravy.  Forgot to mention we started with a cup of their incredibly delicious creamed cabbage and Stilton soup. Wow!   The rest of us had their much touted fish and chips and that I can tell you I've had many,many times in many,  many places but these were exceptionally good. One very large,  thick piece of perfectly done, fresh Icelandic cod lightly breaded-and one was enough. One diner and I substituted the fries for onion rings which we both loved.  The fish and chips come with a generous portion of peas... Very English indeed. Service was outstanding from the minute we walked in until the minute we left. Our waitress Jessica was not only very friendly and outgoing but treated us like guests in her home.  We definitely will go back and we hope we get Jessica again. I would recommend the Crown and Anchor.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zc7dF_YCieK8RVv7CH_oOA.text: The service here can be slow at times, and they don't have much for vegetarians, but the veggie burger they do have is pretty good.  Their salad is interesting, with beets in the mix, and I admit that even though I'm not usually a fan of them, I'll eat them in this salad.  The real benefit to this place is that it's open 24/7, so if you want to go to a bar or grab some food late night, this is definitely an option.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p8aNrG0-38l-ODNLkLJQuA.text: Friendly staff and a great selection of beers. Abviance is totally unexpected and really makes the bar. We almost didn't stop however, because the outside of the place is so bland and unassuming. If it wasnt for the fact we needed to be close to the airport at that time we never would have stopped. Who knew the was such a cool place waiting inside? Advice? Hire someone to spice up the outside to draw people in, you have to be  missing out on a lot of potential customers.

kqW5lem0FtyiqnRFv5gJvg.text: Absolutely love this place. Great character, away from the hustle and bustle. Nice dog friendly patio. Extremelt helpful and friendly staff! Hubby had the steak sandwich, probably the best I'veever tasted.  I had the gish and chips. And those were definitly the best I've ever had. Good light batter, and a very very thick piece of cod. The flavor was amazing!   The chips, (fries) are large and perfectly cooked.  Definitely a go to while visiting Vegas!!  Our server Jessica was an absolute doll!! And very attentive ever though she had tables all over the place! Thank you for a great meal and great time!

b8DrTzDC8-wdbxqDQMdAGg.text: I've been going to try one of the Crown and Anchors for sometime and never got to stopping there.  I met friends the other night who suggested this for dinner and off we were.  They have been there several times and could reocmmend things.  For an appetizer, I got a sausage roll, a spiced sausage wrapped and baked in a flaky pastry.  The sausage came sliced and was accompanied by a dish of mustard sauce that was excellent.  It really gave the sausage a nice flavor although it was good without the mustard.  For the mains, all three of us got steak and kidney pie.  This was a first for me and I enjoyed it a lot.  The steak cubes were very tender and the kidney had a very smooth texture and was quite flavorful.  The pie was topped by a flaky crust and it was piping hot.  (Sweeney Todd fans will get that).  With the pie comes mashed potatoes and gravy and a healthy serving of peas.  It turns out to be a large and filling meal.  Service was a little off.  One of my friends ordered water with her drink at the outset and was not brought it until near the end of the meal when she had to ask again.  Also, after being seated, the staff wasn't sure whose table it was until we asked.    I could easily be a fan of the Crown and Anchor but they have to be better with service.

U5ARcoVjz7Im9Owpp-fSNg.text: Came to this place at night for appetizers and drinks. I ordered a drink called mink bikini. It was pretty good. For food we got onion rings and buffalo wings. The atmosphere is awesome and the servers are so attentive and kind. I'll be coming back.

tMHyTYVyy1UtOx8BRbhqqg.text: Great food and great for watching football. Monika and Magdalene are are just charming as they are beautiful.

g-nBS9VegiPwrChg8sjyeQ.text: Very disappointed  - read a ton of great reviews but I was not impressed!  Sticky table, musty smell, cold peas, long wait for fish and chips. A good size portion of fish but only one and it had NO flavor.  We noted the pot roast delivered to another table which looked good but I doubt that we will give it a second chance.  Ya just don't get a second chance to make a first impression!

jdPJupL5qdl_v2FFoWYLUw.text: Love this place ! Eaten here a few times recently and the service and food were both very good.

bVwiQdD4fdUK5hu21Pc0MA.text: Love this place. We come here a lot to check out the great English food, huge beer selection, play darts, trivia and play video poker.  They have a little bit of everything here and it's definitely a fun pub.  Conveniently located on Tropicana a block away from UNLV.  They get a great crowd too for the games.
