Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hb8MGvZe3qfzxgNRQyUoGQ.text: They have two locations that I know of. This one is by UNLV and the other is in China Town (I haven't gone to that one yet).  I love coming here for fish & chips. The slice of cod is huge and it comes with a side of fries and peas. If you're like me and don't like peas, you can have them get you some extra fries instead at no extra charge. The fish is not overly battered, I love the batter though, so I would love to have more of it, but the fish more than makes up for it.   I've also had their chicken tenders, which is your average chicken tenders, but they're pretty good. They're the typical ones you find in the frozen section of your grocery store. At least to me that's what they taste like.   I always get a pint a beer with whatever I'm ordering, unless it's the middle of the day, but I'm here usually at night.   It's a very friendly environment and they have several draft beers and also some bottled ones. This one is close to UNLV and since I'm always at UNLV this is the place I go to when I want some good dinner and a beer nearby before heading home. It's not quiet or loud, but has this nice vibe to it, at least to me. It is a bit dark inside but it gives you the feeling of a real pub.

MDREoaMRIUwR26B-L2smmg.text: Always fun to be at this location. Leslie the bartender is super nice and we always sit at the bar to chat with her as well. Love the home made kettle cooked chips here. I wish they served liquor at the bar, but we can do with beer and Leslie's company.

fZFCEHz_k54Jokr1n6L8Ug.text: Went for fish and chips. Mediocre. Miller 'a Ale House is much better. Service was horrible. 20 min. Before the sever checked on us each time.

NWdXz1qeczuC98llFDzcSw.text: I posted my last review of the Crown & Anchor back in 2009.  I visited the pub again this weekend and was a little less impressed sadly.  The place looks a little shabby  and dirty on the inside these days.  I went there to watch Spurs give Man U a nice kicking at Old Trafford and was sad to see the state of the place.  Broken chairs, dirty carpets, dust and cobwebs hanging off everything.  Makes you wonder what state the kitchen is in.....  For a bar that shows so much sport I was amazed at the state of the TV's.  Some of them look 20 years old, the quality of the picture on the big screen was absolutely awful.  No HD Box?  Are we living in 1995? It's criminal that any bar showing sports doesn't have good TV's and a HD feed.  You can get 55" LCD HDTV's these days for $800! I watched the game on a 21" TV! Just goes to show the owners aren't investing/looking after the property.  The one thing that was a positive was the staff, they were great, especially the french waitress that looked after us (at least I think she was french).  Next time I want to see a game in Vegas I'll head elsewhere, it's just not worth the trip off the Strip these days. The 45 min wait for a taxi when we tried to leave sucked too!!

blZZ3mkEpTjPInXvONRRbA.text: I've driven by Crown and Anchor many times in past Vegas visits and wanted to stop but the timing wasn't right. Today was the day though I'm in very glad I did!  Aside from the Queen not being there live, this place is all British all the time.  The decor is great, food amazing, staff friendly and fun.  Prices terrific also. I already plan on coming back tomorrow for lunch again.   The only thing that threw me was you can't drink liquor at the bar. Beer and wine yes, hard booze no. I roll with the punches so no big deal, but personally I like hanging out at the bar won't stop me from coming since everything else is great.

RbrNLEU32j3O9BeiwIMA8Q.text: I've come to Crown and Anchor since 2012 for personal and professional reasons. Today I went back for the first time in a couple of years and there was a bartender who was INCREDIBLY rude and argumentative. I order a drink and she physically pulled me over to talk about how the drink I ordered was not correct. She was trying to fight with customers and didn't want to hear us out when we said we were used to a different order. If these are the type of people they are hired here now, AVOID this place!

u70-YI1qk5XwQO_cd9ThiA.text: So disappointed in this place. I would give it no stars if I could. It had been a few years since we have been in but we came in for fish and chips remembering they were good. Drove in from Boulder City. This place is dirty, smells, sticky crumby tables and even had a long brown hair in my soda. We honestly should have left but again we remember the fish being tasty. Never ever again Crown and Anchor. Even if the fish is decent the need to run home and shower right away is not worth it. After we ate we ran to Bass Pro Shops and both my husband and had to run to the bathroom before we even were done shopping. The waitress even gave us the wrong bill and there were only 3 tables. Poor service and if you are thinking about this place you may want to go else where. Just my opinion.

yTFDAUeG4Sxz7au4tqLSsg.text: I saw this place on google maps and decided to give it a go since it was within walking distance from my apartment. I was very pleased with the service I received at the bar, my glass was never empty the entire 2-3 hours I was there. The bartender even charged my phone behind the counter when it had died!  Food was delicious, I sampled the potato skins and the traditional fish and chips. The ale, Smithwick's, was cold and refreshing as well. Although it's not the biggest bar, it is very cozy and there are lots of TV's around the bar so you can keep up with sports while you hang out. They were about to start Karaoke right before I went home, kinda wish I would have stayed and watched; that would have been entertaining!  All in all, I do plan on returning and frequenting this pub; I really enjoyed the atmosphere at at this place.

S5mtx1Kvzyz1Eh-cC6QG7g.text: This pains me to write this review as I'm English and lived here 7 years with numerous great memories of watching England games with fellow expats here. This is the second time in a couple months I've been to come sit in the beer garden, have a beer and a roast dinner with friends, both being very disappointing. The garden is very dated, has rubbish / fag butts everywhere and had to watch my dog like a hawk to stop him Eating them, the beers were flat and tasted like the lines haven't been cleaned in months, the roast dinners were both probably the worst I've ever had, with a burnt / gooey centred Yorkshire pudding I could use as a weapon and the roast potatoes still hard in the middle (Cleary from frozen, which is fine when cooked properly!) the meat was Ok but a lot to be desired. I know I'm not dining at a Michelin star restaurant but I know the owners are English and I invite them to mystery shop their current chef as I know they'd be livid with what I've been served.   Again I love this pub / atmosphere on big events, but i write this in the hopes that you have a word with the chef / head Barman to solve these issues, as I've spoken with a few other ex regulars who had similar Grievances as myself and don't want to stop Coming here / recommending you guys.  ***In response to reply - thanks for getting back to me, I've attached a photo of my food for you to see that the beer was flat, Yorkshire pudding was pretty burnt and the potatoes were under cooked / hard in the middle. But again I'm sure it's an easy fix, just know as a business owner I'd want to know if my customers weren't receiving a good standard for their money! Cheers Joel

jhQEmv7P1m4gWMhFIULXmg.text: I am a native Las Vegan, and after spending more nights than I can count at Crown and Anchor, it pains me to write this review. This pub was a staple when I was in my 20s... we'd drink, eat, throw darts, and enjoy trivia nights here. And the fish and chips were awesome!  Fast forward to many years later, a friend suggested we grab dinner here while killing some time in the neighborhood, waiting to pick our kids up from an event. Of course, I was down to go, and was looking forward to the fish and chips! The pub was very smoky and dingy, the way I remembered it. To me that's part of the atmosphere though... it's a pub! Out of nine of us there that  night, two of us ordered the fish and chips.   Out comes a dish that I didn't quite remember... peas, check. Chips... check. Decent looking fish... NOPE. There was one piece of large, heavily breaded, greasy fish, shaped like a brick. I took a bite, and thought, hmm... I don't know if I should be eating this. I only ended up taking a couple more bites after that, and unfortunately my friend who ordered it as well ate the whole thing.  Fast forward to later that night, we both got violently ill... at almost the exact same time. Everyone else we are with were fine, but the two of us were in for a painful, uncomfortable, sleepless night. Unfortunately, 48 hours later we are both still having gastrointestinal issues (I'll spare you the details), which is making us both nervous. My friend is thinking of calling the county to file a formal complaint.  Bottom line... eat here at your own risk. This definitely isn't the Crown and Anchor it used to be.

50WLXUnfASSbXyfmZITXPA.text: Don't expect a trendy celebrity chef place. This is a True, dingy, dive bar of a pub. No frills. No gimmicks. Just cold beer and good food. 30 Beers on tap. Simple British pub food. Pure happiness!

yuxT9rEMB657l4-qkK879w.text: A night-time adventure in Vegas. Somehow, glowsticks become involved. Then along comes 5am. Time to find a quick bite to eat and head back to the ranch.   My proximity suggested I pay my first visit to Crown & Anchor on Trop. On the bucket-list since lots of Yelp colleagues have been praising the dining there. If the graveyard cook is on-point, then dinner certainly going to measure up.  I ordered "the graveyard burger." That's just $5.95 for a 8-ounce, cheesed-up, baconed-up, tasting-of-charcoal, juicy piece of meat, with a side of pretty-crispy steak fries. Yeah - this WAS a good idea!   Jason, the bartender attending, offered up intelligent convo before & after my plate. Much more than other graveyard mixologists often muster.  Since I am not big on either drinking or sports, to me this space would be about the food.   But if I urged to tap a Guinness Stout (my beer of choice when I do imbibe) ... here would certainly be a good spot for it.  Only a few stools were being warmed, not surprisingly at this time-of-morning. But, according to Jason, if you want to party with college students at 1am ... or if you want to slip away from the nearby Strip to take in a live Euro soccer game at 7am with your team's jersey & some pub-grub ... this venue also qualifies well.  Me, I'll be back at some point to take in the dinner menu. The burger sold it. And I found out there is an AYCE Fish-n-Chips deal, 5pm-midnight on Mondays.   Ummm. AYCE. My favorite culinary monogram.  Oh, it's a British pub concept throughout. But you already knew that.  UPDATE: I've been back to test the AYCE Fish-n-Chips deal. Not too exciting actually. One plank, then the refills one plank each. Not near as tasty/crispy/greasy as found the Village Pubs. And I've had my fill at Village Pub for $10, less than the AYCE here. But our redhead server Brittany, who went well out of her way to be prompt & conversational, assures I will return, but to test out other sections of the menu.   Tally-Ho!

8c80HDYNcyQ2XJaxvzvWmA.text: The dog friendly patio is so great!  Jessica is our go to server, she is just great with the dogs and the best server around - dogs or no dogs.  She's a keeper, don't let her get away.  Chicken fingers and chips are so good too!

ZeJ8k2b3Q8hznUnK6LKDwg.text: This place promises the best Fish & Chips in Las Vegas...& they deliver. In fact it would be fair to say they're better than any fish & chips I've ever had in the UK, they surpass authentic, they are quite simply delicious. The fish is white, thick and flakey and the batter is crispy, melt in the mouth heaven. They do have an extensive menu...& I keep promising myself that I will go back and try the Cornish pasties & the bangers & mash or the steak pie...but so so far I've ordered fish & chips every time (it's that good) I've taken friends back with me and we added the large Yorkshire Pudding as an appetizer & again, you really won't be disappointed. It could seriously have come straight of a pub in my native Yorkshire...expect its huge! Huge and well risen and comes with both gravy and a honey dipping sauce, which I'd never heard of but I googled it and it is actually a thing... The Guinness is served ice cold, the staff are super friendly, inside it feels like a proper English pub (& not an American Sports bar pretending to be an English pub) with wood panels, a suit of amour and English soccer playing on the TV's. That said, I'm usually out on the patio because I take my dogs, there's a grassy area, water bowls are provided and they even have dog biscuits....really, this place couldn't be more accommodating. And it's open 24 hours.

ph6dOmUVQT2utFuxPPCOWw.text: On 02/13/2019, one of my friends and co-workers had a Birthday and myself and 30+ of our friends and co-workers decided to go to Crown and Anchor.   To say that it was a disgraceful experience would be an understatement!   To start off the night, being a Wednesday, we decided to try this establishment because the website says it was industry night and that the first beer is free but the bartender, Troy (I believe that was what we were told his name was) refused to acknowledge that and charged us even after showing him our badges as we were all Strip Casino employees.   Troy was so rude to all of us and kept yelling and screaming at us because we were unaware of the liquor license that separated where we were able to drink hard liquor. Rather than explain it to us, he just kept screaming and yelling to "get the f*ck out of the bar area" with our hard liquor.   After I paid for my first beer with A $20 dollar bill, Troy set down my beer and literally threw my change at me. At one point in the night he began to throw the drink menus around the bar because they were in his way and he almost hit someone.  The cocktail server that night was absolutely amazing and very helpful. It was unfortunate to her that Troy acted the way that he did because it made her lose out on tips.   At one point, Troy had made a mistake and brought a second order of chicken fingers to one of our friends, who had already been served the chicken fingers by the server, and Troy blamed our friend, saying to him, "This is why you need to stay in your f*cking seat!"   Troy was also very upset that we kept ordering shots of Petrone because he kept having to pour them and apparently that was too much work.   Then later in the night, once the DJ was done playing and after the bartender was done singing a song about how big his testicles were (because that was an appropriate song for him to choose), one of our friends put a $20 bill in the jukebox and began to choose a song to play. At this time, Troy ran from behind the bar yelling at our friend, saying that he's the DJ in the bar and that he chooses the songs. After my friend choose two songs to play, after about 10 seconds of the song playing, Troy skipped both songs. My friend then asked Troy for his $20 back since he was going to keep skipping the songs he plays and Troy replied by telling him to go f*ck himself because he already said that he is the DJ in the bar and he chooses the songs.  At this point my friend asked Troy what is issue was and Troy decided to once again run from behind the bar and get into my friends face and say "what the f*ck are you going to do about it?" Troy continued to scream and swear at our group.   At that point we decided it was time for our party of 30 to leave the bar and go down the street to PTs where we knew we would be treated better. Not at any point leading to the time we left, were we ever rude to Troy. We are all grown adults and were trying to enjoy our fiends Birthday and Troy completely ruined it for us.  In the end, not only did that very nice and respectful server lose out on tips, but this establishment lost out on revenue and lost 30+ customers because of Troy's actions.   I have never experienced someone treat people so bad in the service industry like that.

2Xc1BZjPiThl16_5qwS0oQ.text: Fun place, gets popping on the weekends while school is in session.  Good beer selection. Fun place, mostly bar food but fair prices.

PSNfTNT0eO5Mkq9qrs7S_A.text: Treat yourself when in Vegas and get the heck off the strip and head on down to a fun little local English Pub.  It was awesome chatting with some locals while dining on traditional fish and chips and shepherds pie along with bangers and English custard.  They were out of several of my top choices for beer.  Old Speckled was out but I was able to enjoy a Boddington.  Loved this place.

dDpiVXVsj8MN31abW8b6hg.text: The Fish and Chips are good, waitresses are pleasant but the bathrooms are disgusting.  Have they never heard of marble tile?  The bathrooms must be 50 years old, gross.  We won't go there anymore until the upgrade the bathrooms.

iU_1VAX9W5UBYLXs5gXzqg.text: If there ever was a bar like the one in "Cheers" it would be this one. Well a british version. It was my go to haunt when I lived in Vegas. I've lived in L.A. and Chicago and this place is truley a gem. Try the chicken fingers, drink guinness, innis n' gunn and watch an early morning football game!

PwL-VSt8Lf6YJ-2FnBQyqw.text: This is definitely the best bar in the area. It has a ton of British charm, European and domestic beers, awesome British food, jukebox, darts, patio, trivia night... What more could you ask for? We usually only come here for trivia night on Thursdays but I've also brought my dog to the patio when it's not too hot out. I always get the Hoegaarden because there aren't many places in town that have it on draft. Chips (french fries) and curry sauce are also a must to snack on. I've had the cornish pastie a few times and it's a delicious and filling meal. I ordered the steak and mushroom pie the last time I was in but I still prefer the cornish pastie. It's wrapped up like a hot pocket vs. inside a deep dish covered in flaky crust. The steak and mushroom pie was a lot runnier and I prefer having flaky crust in every bite vs. more filling.  I've also been to the all you can eat fish and chips on Mondays. They give you a huge piece of fish to start and after that they give you smaller pieces, but it's definitely enough food.    The inside is built like a tavern or wooden cabin. The bar layout is a little strange with a seating area in front of the bar that can only be accessed from one direction. There's a dining room, outdoor patio, and dart area. There are also two staircases that go to upstairs lofts. I've gone up the stairs above the dining room (more dining) but I've never been to the side above the dart area. Are there pool tables up there? I never see anyone up there. So mysterious...   Trivia night is a little deceiving if you've been to any other trivia nights in town. It runs from 9-10 and it consists of only 10 questions. You get a $50 bar tab if you win. It's a casual activity to partake in over a few beers and a late dinner. The one thing that seems to throw everyone off at Crown is that they don't serve shots or any liquor at the bar. The sign on the chalkboard says you must be at a table with food, though the bartenders explain it as you just have to be at a table outside of the bar area and they will bring the liquor over to you.   The Crown and Anchor is a solid bar with friendly staff, great beer selection, and delicious British food. Everyone seems to have a good time and it's not incredibly smoky and antisocial like most every other neighborhood bar. It does seem to attract a lot of foreign tourists which is interesting because it's not super close to the Strip and there aren't other bars in the area to bar hop to. It makes it fun though as you can strike up a conversation with a lot of cool people.

vynn4-zjZeDJRTq0eE8yLQ.text: Fun place! Friendly Bartenders good food! Love their house made chips. Enjoy coming here for trivia too--I'm a regular!

20J2bGI6dpRfuF64A6sIRA.text: Pricey but different. The food is awful. Seriously, the food is awful. I totally mean it, the food is awful! The service is great and the variety of drinks is awesome, unmatched for a local bar.

zuNii7D_KtskYPxw9w8elw.text: So it's been a long time coming. Since I moved here in 07 I've been meaning to check this joint out and I'm glad 10 years later I finally did. SMH!  Known for late nights and pub hanging I came for the food and atmosphere. I got both and then some. The servers and service was great and the vibe gave me a sense of actually being in London and the food was so good.   The only thing was I left smelling like cigarette smoke and it lingered. Other then that I was super satisfied with everything. Good old local spot that is also a cool attraction for visitors. Price were decent and the accents of the servers are on point!  We came over on a late Wednesday night and got seating right away. Walking in a small hallway with then English flag swagging in the entrance instantly transport you to a drunken good time in a pub in England. There is a small bar low ceilings and lots of wood work.  The waitress mostly all wore red plaided skirts. The menu was completely fitting but I don't remember if they offered Beef Wellingtons if so I would've been all over it.  Never the less I had my old English (Old-fashion)and the Scotch Egg aka a hard boiled egg encased in a meat. I ordered it warm but it is also served cold but I'm not sure how that would taste, the server suggested not to order cold unless you actually grew up eating it that way. The egg soaked up all the good flavor of the meat and the ground tender meatball type casing was so good.   The Fish and chips were yummy flaky batter and fries were just thick cut was fresh warm and crispy skin with soft potato inside. The mash and gravy served with the herb chicken was so tasty.   I will be back for sure to try everything else like the flaky crust beef and mushroom pie and lamb stew and Yorkshire pudding omg looks so bomb.   Ok I have to stop cause my mouth is watering right now. Anyway if you haven't been you must try cause you won't be disappointed!

3RwWzp2bexY0E0o9hvtthw.text: Talk about the perfect neighborhood pub. This place is an excellent destination for food and having a good time.  All of the menu items are tasty and moderately priced. The fish and chips is fluffy and crusted with a batter that isn't too heavy. Getting a burger with Stilton cheese on it is worth the visit alone. Unless you really like chips(fries) I would recommend the Crown Crisps, they are homemade potato chips and are super addictive.  I had never tried kidneys before, but the steak and kidney pie is delicious. Expect to spend around $30-$40 for two, and a little more if one is drinking.  Speaking of drinking, they have a full bar and 30 beers on tap. Ranging from lagers to IPAs, to the dark beers and even some ciders. About the only thing that would make it better is if they would put Strongbow on draft, currently they only have it in a bottle... which is a vastly subpar way to drink Strongbow.  Service has always been on point every time I've come here. Lesley is one of the best bartenders around, pouring alcohol for all of one's needs. If you choose to dine at a table and are lucky enough to get Catherine as your server, then you'll be getting some of the best service in Vegas.  All in all, I highly recommend this place. I know that I will continue to be giving them my money.

ZhGV0LkZcVYuSngdzJ9YxA.text: Better than 4 stars, but not 5.  Fish and chips was jammin!  Icelandic cod!  Instead of bread, you can order a yorkshire pudding app.  Also, the handmade chicken fingers (yeah - they're known for this) was great.  That was also very good.  Apple cobbler dessert with bird pudding was very very good.  Just wished I had enough room to try the scotch egg...  Overall, this place is a good fun local restaurant.

1KCLki1W0-SFvY-C57SaNQ.text: When you enter the restaurant the cigarette smoke odor is overwhelming.  The tables sticky.  The restaurant needs a good cleaning.  The wait staff is very professional.  The food is ok.

aUC0ykKBhmkHmi9hz_JeNA.text: Service is very slow - they always are understaffed - the prices are fine, and they say they have the best fish and chips, but it's really just average. Chicken fingers appetizer is surprisingly good though.

AGBGExS885YkIyPypiiDdA.text: Good beer at amazing prices compared to the Strip.  Very close to the pinball museum.  The bartenders were not friendly at all.    I can now say I have tried a Scotch Egg, and I can also say I will never try it ever again.  Ew.

xAsWKfpNaNLI1U6G1H67pA.text: I'm pretty sure they fry food in unicorn piss because it's magical!  All of it - chicken fingers, onion rings, mozzarella sticks, etc. You can go wrong. I had a steak and mushroom pie and the crust was...you guessed it, magical.   Our waitress was Tracy she was super sweet and attentive.

EDn1bDjxgUgOA4BfbbFnkQ.text: Fun bar my local Vegas friends took me to away from the Strip. It was great to go away from the hustle, bustle and tourism and come here. I didn't hear a lick of British while I was here though. Maybe next time.  Service was unbearably slow, although my friends assured me this usually isn't the case so I'll take their word for it.  For both food and beer, the portions are giant. You definitely get your money's worth. I liked the variety of British food, but just wanted some chicken wings. Like I said, huge portion size and number. I had a good 8-9 wings. I was a little disappointed that the sauce came on the side, although it was just hot sauce (and also ranch).  The crowd was lively for a Thursday night, although the television audio wasn't on (because it was college basketball?)

Xr7J5O9g6xMU2RiV6JR4yw.text: Have a beer or two or few. Eat delicious fish and chips and practice hitting a bullseye. No betting though, LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Go ahead and break these golden nuggets in 2...you&#39;ll get steaming white cod, thick portion. I was impressed.

Ql_dm7Of0Q0lyuo-WPGUfw.text: I love this bloody place!  One of the few places in Vegas that I honestly miss.  The all you can eat English fish & chips (Monday night), chicken curry, chicken & leek pie and Lancashire hot pot are some of my favorite menu items.  Big beer selection and full bar lacking the typical douchebag Vegas tourist is a huge plus.  Most of the out-of-towners are here visiting with a local.   Friendly, prompt waitresses and bartenders do their job well.  Parking can be a bitch at times but that's the only negative that comes to mind.  Oh...that and the mens bathroom sink's water pressure is up pretty high so when you turn it on, you get splashed in the front of your pants making it look like you wee'd on yourself.  Crown & Anchor has done a damn fine job making you feel as if you are in an authentic "British Pub"  so much so that you forget you are still in Vegas (which is a good thing.)    Cheers!

T4d-l6Xa_7eMk5yfgmlP5w.text: We love coming here once a week with our pit bull Zeus.  They have an outdoor area perfect for dogs that is fenced in.  It's ideal and hard to find in this city.  The service is always great.  My husband loves the chicken fingers and fries.  I love their English Garden Salad.  I have never had a bad meal here.  When we come for breakfast which is served all day, they always bring Zeus some extra bacon and a sausage.  He loves this place.

UlVCV8mg_O7PqpRiqaVHNg.text: I like to watch English Premier League soccer here a couple of times a year.  Great beer selection on draft and decent food.  The only drag is that it is a bit dusty in there, but it is not a dive.  I like the bangers and mash, fish and chips, ploughman's lunch, and Sheppard's pie.

bx_4poU6DFubtN2fP1th4g.text: Fun bar. I went here with some friends for a few beers and was weary because I heard some negative reviews. Service was great and the atmosphere was fun

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TDEtdFCRlO6t0YPtQJiUkw.text: Nice beer selection & cheap food.  They have Chimay on draft, however they no longer offer this in the beers that they will comp for players.  We've taken part in their Thursday Night Trivia Challenge twice, but it's rather disappointing due to disorganization and it's impossible to understand the announcer because of faulty audio equipment.

DUGbRS8fccW9KVPGRkNBIw.text: Cute place, great fish and chips. 2.5 stars is my real real rating. No comps, super tight poker. We played 150 dollars and paid for beers, lame. Service was rushed and the waitress kissed our asses at the end. The coke was flat in my two rum and cokes. Not a bad place, but not gaming friendly.

CcQ7ElJpo0gVIVCn7Qogtw.text: Used to love this place. The last 3 times here in the past 2 months just waited too long for service.  Last night went with husband and daughter to eat outside on the patio and never got served. Left after 15 minutes of nothing. Used to be great place but service is just terrible and there are too many choices to go back somewhere with bad service.

bPeKyS9FYxyacFjcHST8wQ.text: We were sat & waited for an eternity it seemed like just to place our food order.  Food server took our drink order & we waited again to give her our food order because she was overwhelmed.  We ordered the beef & mushroom pie, Fish & chips, Chicken cordon Bleu, Potato skins, Chicken wings & A side salad.  The potato skins were tasty but super soft and limp.  The chicken fingers? We didn't order fingers.  WINGS! The pie was delicious but very small, almost like a kids plate for almost $13.00?!?!? The chicken cordon Bleu was dry to the point that my son had to add Tabasco to moisten it.  The fish & chips was ONE giant & tasty piece of fish. The batter got smooshie  under it.  The wings finally came out and they were heavily battered to the point that it hurt to bite through them.  We felt like our food server had no urgency to try and at least give us the proper attention without delay.  We still tipped them 20% no matter what, but we probably not be going back again.  We are being 100% honest & we hope this review helps you guys out.   [like my wife said: "the food server was probably having a bad night"] I hope our generosity helped her out :/

cqRr_J6fNcNpIxA9W-We1w.text: We have been in twice in the previous month to get a British staple: Fish & Chips.  The first time, we were not told it was AYCE until I saw the sign on our way out. My fish was cooked alright, smallish portions for the price, but not a horrible meal, just a bit overpriced for one serving.  This go around, we ordered the AYCE Fish & Chips and hoped for a filling meal. For over two hours we were at Crown & Anchor, we received our first PIECE of fish, granted, the one piece per plate was fairly substantial. However, it was still just one piece. Shortly after devouring that one piece, my stomach was screaming for more food. It was not until we had been at C&A for over an hour the second piece made its way out. That was it. Two pieces of fish in two hours.   I feel places like this should change the name from "All You Can Eat" to "All We Decide To Serve".  Also, if you are a bar/restaurant... HOW DO YOU RUN OUT OF GLASSES?! The place was not even full and our server apologized multiple times for not being able to bring out drinks in a timely fashion and our friends that wanted a glass of ice to go with their bottled drinks could not have one because, "We're out of glasses." Seriously? There is a serious problem when a bar does not have enough glasses to cover a moderately busy night.

dvdqQVtnY5RJfwnPaVmang.text: I was looking for a place away from all the overpriced places on the Strip and I had a hankering for fish and chips. Driving down E. Tropicana I saw the Crown and Anchor and it looked like just the place.  The ambience is just what you'd expect except for the gambling machines that dominate the bar. Oh well , it is Vegas after all. I was greeted and seated immediately and the service remained very good throughout my meal. The menu looked very tempting and included all of the standard British pub fair. I was very tempted to try the Steak and Mushroom pie, but I was there for the Fish and Chips. The meal came out very quickly and looked delicious. The fish was maybe haddock and was well cooked, moist and flakey. However the batter had a bitter taste; maybe old oil or maybe aluminized baking powder in the batter, which I'm sensitive to. It was  not overwhelming, but enough that I would not order it again. The chips were great (which maybe points to the batter rater than the oil) and the included peas, well they were peas. I gave  them a 3, but if I rated then strictly on this  meal it would have been lower. I do have a feeling a different night or a different entre may have been much better. I may give them another shot next time I am in Vegas, maybe the Steak and Mushroom pie  next time

Tvid_hbPsOFZkFG5oQkEcg.text: My favorite bar in Vegas! Great staff, food, and beer selection. Best fish and chips in town. Great place to watch sports, and the ONLY place to watch international soccer. Also love the uniforms.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. World Cup game, Mexico vs. Brazil. Felt like I was at the game.

PhjaABR0U64VlKZFr8961Q.text: I have made a few trips to England and Ireland sampling their fish & chips. I've got to tell you yours is fantastic. They should learn from you. Excellent!! I frequent your restaurant at least three times a month. The last two visits had me somewhat embarrassed with the loud profanity echoing from the bar. I am typically there with my family including grandchildren. Just inappropriate ! I think as you grow your business you may want to consider what type customers you want to attract????  Thanks for your quick response Richard. I was there last Saturday 8/22.

MHxX1WzqiQDmmXFdzaKZTQ.text: Just went for a random Monday aft premiere league game. Was great!! Bartender was very upbeat. Game was on and could be heard. Very enjoyable!!

6DJJePZl0F5tGJ-uqD3tRw.text: Good service and great food! Monday special - all you can fish-n-chips.  Most of the food is house made.

aIXOtFTCyKGVg_MIg6tb7g.text: Las Vegas, Nevada ---  Day 99 "DUSA Tour 2016" ... bar #1  "Crown & Anchor Pub" was a British-themed sports bar   menu is "extreme" British food , but not a "Run-A-Way Bill" food fare   they have a "Down the Hatch" beer club, plus Happy Hour & Graveyard Hours specials   No customer interaction other than TV interaction   bartender/serves look great in her Catholic-school (British) skirts   my bartender did not introduced herself   NOT  a "Run-A-Way Bill" Favorite, but mainly because I do not like USA sports, let alone British sports ...  #RunAwayBill #DUSATour2016    "Run-A-Way Bill" was here! 07.18.16  -----  things can change ...  Las Vegas, Nevada ---  The "Dispensary Lounge" is bar 260 "DUSA 2017" (Discover USA) ...  Not a "Run-A-Way Bill" Favorite bar/bartender, but may be a great Jazz "comfort zone" on Friday & Saturday nights ...  bartender was more interested in her cell phone than the customers ..,  day 079 "DUSA 2017" (Discover USA)  day 132 "666 Bars of 2017"   "Run-A-Way Bill" was here!   #RunAwayBill #666BarsUSA #LasVegasRAB #WorldsLongestBarCrawl #DUSA2017   05.12.17

Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZYv2j7SX4XsD9oj86F4weA.text: This is a pretty accurate British pub experience, just a few miles off Strip. I am a real Anglophile, so really enjoyed the decor. The servers and atmosphere are friendly, and the food is authentic England- bangers and mash, mushy peas, kidney pie, Yorkshire pudding, etc. I highly recommend the Stilton and cabbage soup, and my hubby raved about the fish and chips. There is a weird provision in their liquor license which only allows beer and wine at the bar, but they can sell spirits if the customer is seated at the more formal and separate dining area.   The only downside to an otherwise great evening was a bar patron who was very intoxicated- loudly shouting/swearing, starting conversations/arguments with diners, and at one point trying to dance but was barely able to balance and backed into our table- but the bartender continued to serve him. Perhaps he is a regular, he was overly friendly with the young, short-skirt clad waitresses as well. I know customer's behaviors are not the blame of the establishment, but management should have insisted he be cut off.  Loud obnoxious drunk aside, I enjoyed the overall aesthetic and recommend the food. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stilton cheese and cabbage soup

Wy7mO9zsWGcDsH88lMRFFQ.text: This place was right around the corner from where we were staying. Open 24 hours and awesome! They do allow smoking inside. Pups on the patio. The staff was great! food was good and drinks were good too!  I had the chicken strips our first time there My boyfriend got a burger and fries. The 2nd time we went I got a meat pie with mushrooms. YUM!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pub
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. meat pie

Fbs_psay-NredJKtDDePog.text: I've always liked this place. Great English style ambiance as well as top notch food & service! They have patio seating that doesn't get used all too often this time of year. For obvious reasons! I'm not much of a drinker or gambler so I cannot really comment on that! Okay peace out!!

5bax_0dVROG6dK1du-1ZYw.text: This place has great ambience! Definitely captures the British pub feel. They have about 30 different draft beers, and ciders too. They are pet friendly on the patio, and they have a full bar. There is a billiard room upstairs. The food was good, we got new Englad clam chowder and the chicken and leek pie. The mashed potatoes were cold. The only reason Im giving 4 stars is because the waitress was kind of absent most of the time. Pricing is reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and leek pie
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England clam chowder
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strongbow cider and old speckled hen draft beer

FpEvQePLlX4c83YvTptU1A.text: Looking for an English pub for lunch?  Crown & Anchor British Pub is a great choice.  They have good traditional pub food.  They have bar seating, sit down restaurant seating and an small outside patio (you can even bring your dog if you sit outside).  The bar area always seems to have soccer games playing.  They have dart boards too!  This is one of the remaining restaurants in town that has Scotch Eggs.  Their menu also has Giant Bread Pudding and shepherds pie (be prepared to wait longer if you order a pie).  Their bartender and waitresses are always friendly and the service is always good; and occasionally great!

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips with peas
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch Egg
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IPXep5dvHNyULX26qiHzdQ.text: Wow! First time, last time coming here! I asked for a particular beer and they're out, ok, I'll order something else. Guess what, they're out of that too! I'm looking at the menu, go to order dinner with a salad, guess what? They are out of lettuce!! Really? And my server isn't even fazed by it! Must be pretty normal around here! As for service, it was really pretty disappointing, hardly a smile and she seemed put out by the whole experience! It's a shame because the food was actually pretty good! Either way, I won't be back. Super bummed because I was hoping to find a new local hangout!

HsOrqJlkuAvPLS-yAVddFg.text: I am split on this I was told to come here for the best fish and chips in town. The fish was disappointing and greasy.  I on the other hand went for the lamb stew in Yorkshire pudding. I have never had a Yorkshire pudding so I wasn't sure what to expect.  What was delivered was a delicious stew in a soft bread bowl/pocket. Heaven!  I was going to get a pastie, but be forewarned there is a 20 minute order time for those and we didn't have that much time.  Would go back again, but not for the fish

2v7QZbA57T1rk13C7nOgPg.text: I come here once or twice every week to get the same beer and sandwich, just to sit by myself and decompress. Jess is a super attentive server but doesn't hover over me, and always takes great care of me. My favorite place to go after a long day at work.

-TI5KWoqCoQl-nfwLiBT5g.text: Best British pub in Vegas! Great environment and authentic food ... we had a pasty and some meat pies and beers. Definitely worth checking out if you want to explore off the strip.

LM_CKNGSwwqVWiA3_6hkew.text: Steve is the reason I come here! Such a good personality and makes me feel at home! Always ask for Steve you won't be disappointed!

wRR0E6mBmUyM8PQsWseNyg.text: Came here for a drink before the 2019 Super Bowl and ended up staying with my friends having the best time eating great British pub food, drinking, and enjoying the game on multiple TVs. Service was awesome as was the food-- would definitely recommend the fish and chips as well as Cornish pasty and bangers and mash. Hell, everything we tried was really good.  I usually try new places for our annual friends SuperBowl Vegas trip. I'm planning to make this our go-to SB spot from now on.

niirB6Afm22Z3sGfES_xwg.text: Thick big crusted FISH roll and Chips thick cut french fries. Whats not to love? Stilton cheese cabbage soup, so rich and rich. Said it twice. Clam chowder had a noteworthy amount of soft clams with other usual ingredients. Creamy and rich. Soup was satisfying.  In and outdoor seating. Sat outside on this glorious Vegas day between two shady trees.  Server Jessica is both beautiful and a great server.  There are lunch specials with $20 gamblers buy in on the bar tops inside, with appetizer specials in its place after 2:30. Lots of parking.

ZilygPMQExZ_UTTBsJsMRw.text: Can't believe they served Yorkshire Puddings that look like this!! The Roast dinner was Arby's Roast Beef! Totally disgusting

_agvAjgyxYlhu4pcmDiZXw.text: Home of the invisible waitress. Went here last night with my bf around 9:30 p.m. No hostess/waitress in the dining area had to grab our own menus from the hostess station and seat ourselves. We are there about 15 minutes or more....still no waitress came by....anywhere. My bf calls from his cell and asks if they have a waitress working in their dining area to which the bartender says yes. We were actually going to wait longer until the bartender hung up and started yelling out to the customers at the bar that he just got a phone call asking if they had a waitress on duty. Uh hello......he didn't even see us sitting right next to him in the dining area. We got up and walked out.

eEVQusLhcaXjKfVQGD5IIA.text: Troy was the best, great atmosphere and vibe. He made some great cocktails . I just wish they had a open sign if it wasn't for the patio we woulda walked by!

H5vIdBiMzBzJe05gvL4tCQ.text: British pub style restaurant located a few miles from the strip.  You can't miss the restaurant from the street. It looks like an old English house. The inside is dimly lit with a dining room and bar area.  The drink menu has full bar options, limited wine, and bottle and draft beer. The food menu has many traditional British dishes like bangers and mash, fish and chips, and meat pastries. I had the steak and mushroom pie which was delicious.  Service was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and mushroom pie

BAa1wrW3Wq3_g0XDQH8_Yg.text: We brought friends from out of town for the all you can eat fish on Monday. The fish was some of the best we have ever had. There was a bit of smoke in the place so better air handlers would help. Only giving 4 stars as they were out of apples for one dessert and we discovered the other dessert which we ordered to go was burned on the top. It still tastes good but disappointed.

q_U0sTzwGXSbms5s6ekUHQ.text: The first of two recommendations by an online friend that used to live in Vegas, and this one I was disappointed in.  Went in late Thursday morning, and the dining room was closed, so I had to sit at the bar. Plenty of people there drinking already (after all, it is Vegas), and the service was just ... slow. From being handed a menu, to taking my order, to receiving my food (which wasn't as warm as I'd liked as a result). The food was fine other than the temperature, and I didn't want to wait another 15 or so minutes for a remake.  The description of two stars ("Meh. I've experienced better.") pretty well sums up my visit.

pOwS1C5P74IbJZyrvucr7w.text: Recently enjoyed another dinner on their patio with my lovin' man. This time, we both were in a breakfast kind of mood, so went for the Gammon and Eggs. Gammon is similar to ham, but the British version is called gammon and is a bit milder than American ham, and the steaks are generally round in shape with a center bone. Eggs were cooked properly, although I wish our plates had been served a little hotter. Overall, another great meal at Crown & Anchor on Trop.  It was a great breakfast, and their great coffee worked beautifully with it to squelch our hankerin' for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gammon and Eggs Breakfast for dinner. Tasty!

dw1P06lwsDpwNSTa_fEe0Q.text: Best Fish & Chips I ever had.  Atmosphere is awesome.  A must for both residents and tourists.

8A7nXjoHK8u_ClNObl9hMg.text: This place is definitely alright. Which if you are English is about as good as it gets. A great place to watch football, and by that I mean soccer.  If you go early in the day you may be treated to Magdalena, who is obviously gorgeous, but there are plenty of gorgeous servers in Vegas, what makes a difference is the banter with the punters. You cannot buy that.  There is a great beer selection and all draught beers served in proper pints.  The food is typical English pub food a very good. The bangers are great, sausage rolls, scotch eggs and pasties. It's all there.  The simple fact is, here in Vegas it's the only place I want to go when watching footy or for a cheeky long lunch.

A_ZD4csKJPSUgDB0Opzm2g.text: Possibly one of the most authentic fish-and-chips in Las Vegas - the only thing missing - the meal properly wrapped in a British newspaper and a cockney speaking bladdered* gooner**  This pub has character. Although it has not been opened for long ( I think I saw something that said 1980s or 90s), it feels like its been around for a very long time.  The dining room is very small and when its at capacity you'll have to wait for a table.  Your best bet is to get a seat at the bar.  At the time of my visit, the waitresses were a bit overwhelmed.  We told the waitress that we'd wait for a table at the bar.  I guess she forgot about us because she sat a party that came though the door before sitting us who were waiting; so, we just opted for sitting at the bar.    The bar tender on the other hand, was super nice.  He ended taking our order and noticing that our food had not come out, compensated our wait with a beer.  Of note is the locals and their understated like for the video poker.  Keep an eye on them, its fun to watch them play.  *bladdered = very drunk **gooner = Arsenal fan (Arsenal is a football team in England)

Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ln9S925ZNm6D19ojYJfw1g.text: Love me some crown and anchor.   The last 2 times I have been in I get the chicken fingers and fries. These are some of the best chicken fingers around. Really good.   This also a good place to grab a drink and hang out with friends. If you are a soccer fan there almost always seems to be a game on.   If you like fish and chips Monday night is your night. It's all you can eat fish and chips. This are also very good.   Last but not least Thursday night at this location is bad singer night. If you like to karoke than this is the place to be. If you like hearing your favorite song ruined also the place to be.   I am a fan of crown and anchor.

w-E4tEbg4jBRbtSD1hr4ww.text: I HATE GIVING THREE STARS . . . but this place was just average for me.  I was hoping that this place would be bigger than life with lot going on . . . a great staff . . . lots to do . . . and plenty to drink.  Well one out of four gets you three stars, but only because it was the PLENTY TO DRINK . . . service was slow, even though the place was dead . . . I would like to think that there are times when this place really gets rocking . . . I just know if it will ever be when I'm in town.  Return trip possible . . . yes . . . but at this point only because of the drink selection.

xa9q0cJ5zuu8ubV-25nm0Q.text: Very good British food, that is to say True to what you'd get in a good pub overseas. Better than the other supposed "British Pubs" in town.  Beer selection is large and reasonably priced. When you need some mushy peas, chips, and pint its worth a stop.

OYehKJdWt0HGucsLRP-RxQ.text: Nice server very helpful played $20 on video poker and received full dinner no Yorkshire pudding like the menu said why do servers always forget stuff it happened the other night at Mimi's too when they forgot my wife's blueberry muffin with her quiche. I was there for a memorial of someone I know who died of alcoholism at age 52

w3Q_WFZuluefEtdpN0l0LA.text: I had lunch with some friends here for a soccer game a couple months ago.  The atmosphere provides a British/European flavor to it.  I've watched world cup games here before and the world cup watching atmosphere is great.  Service was excellent and the dining room waitress was attentive.  She was nice enough to switch the TV to another Champions League game for us.  I really like the fish and chips.  The only better version I've had is when I ate lunch by the sea in Ireland at a restaurant that made the fish from the morning's catch.  The chicken fingers are at or near the best I've had for that dish in Las Vegas.  The beer selection is excellent and you can get a lot of english beers that are not readily available at other bars in Las Vegas.  This bar is a great place for on-strip tourists to get a flavor of off-strip and a great place for locals.  May want to pass on this bar if you don't like crowds and it is around world cup time (especially an England game or St. Patricks day).

3VO-ptSpRUNhEZ-e6iVY9g.text: The fish and chips were excellent.  Was very fairly priced and would go back when I am in town.  Really want to try the Sunday Roast dinner.

dhqrlg--DwjF6HMAY_lOzw.text: Service sucks.  Their fries suck.  They don't even season them with anything in the kitchen.    I can get better fries at McDonald's.    The table beside me ordered fish n' chips and it's literally 1 piece of fish and a plate full of fries.  That is insane.  You could at least put 3-4 pieces of fish.  Their menu is too big.  I hate it when a menu is a novel.  I see this a lot in Vegas.  They need to cut it down and focus on just a few premier dishes that they do really really well.    No need for 4 pages of food if you do 7 dishes really really well and just knock it out of the park.

6BcVsYITcd36zXAUwaeQnQ.text: While I'm not British, this place Feels Authentic. They know the difference between a black & tan and a half & half. Lots of rowdy UK folks shouting for their team when a game is on, having lots of fun. It doesn't hurt that the waitresses are cute and wearing little kilt dresses. (They do that in England, right?) And the food seems real, too, like bangers and mash, lamb stew, and things I've not yet raised the courage to try. It's dark, with a few electrical outlets here and there. They don't mind you camping out getting work done on your laptop as long as you're paying your way. One of my favorite places to get real writing done uninterrupted. No WiFi as far as I can tell, so I turn on my phone's hotspot.

ogx5KbOep5ow5ha1C48xlQ.text: It was my first time coming to this pub and I was actually kinda excited since we had just gotten out of a concert and were looking for somewhere to just chat and grab food and a beer. I went in with a group and we ordered our drinks at the bar. All the seats were full at the bar, but there was no one in the little restaurant area aside from the group outside and a few other people just chatting, not eating at a table not too far from where we decided to sit. First off, we couldn't find someone to seat us which is why we just decided to find an area ourselves. Trying to get one of the waitresses' attention was another thing as well. They were darting so fast to the group outside that they completely disregarded us. Eventually, someone in our group just decided to try to get her attention because she was so flustered at the fact that we had been waiting so long and the only table that appeared to have ordered anything was a group outside. I ended up ordering the Mozzarella sticks while everyone else got chicken fingers and/or curry. Our meal took a good while. At least, it felt like it. We burned through so many conversations that I began to wonder if our server had gotten our order out. She finally came around and brought us our food. Keep in mind that during this whole time, everyone at the table had already gotten through their drinks and she had walked past us quite a handful of times and not once even asked us if we wanted any other drinks. Mozzarella sticks were the BOMB.com. The guys liked the chicken fingers, however, the curry order was wrong. It was ordered without chicken but had so much of it that our friend wasn't happy with it at all. We finished our food (except the curry plate) and still had to wait for our server to even check up on us. The service on a scale of 1-10 was at a 3 for me. I completely understand that she was checking up constantly on the group outside, being that they were a larger group, but if I had known she wouldn't have shown us the same courtesy, I would've opted to go to another pub or bar instead. Treat your customers right. All we wanted was to just be checked up on and offered drinks. It wouldn't have been anything complicated. What's annoying to me is that she preferred to give another group good service, but couldn't even provide us with basic service. How are you so sure we wouldn't have left a great tip for you just for checking up on us as you were darting by? Instead, we were ignored. The fact that it wasn't even busy, let alone she wasn't the only server there is just the icing on top of it all. I'm not sure the food is worth coming back for. In all honesty, I'm the type of person who if I go to a cool bar/pub/restaurant/etc. I always share it with people and bring them back with me. My first experience was mediocre. Pretty disappointing. In the meantime, I think I'll have to stick to Gold Spike or Park.

sseoNRz3cFRQ-yG_ffrUcw.text: Crown & Anchor is nice for a good beer and bar food. Apparently friends of mine like their fish and chips, but I do not eat fish, so I cannot tell you from experience. The potato skins though are pretty good.  They have a wide variety of beers to choose from, as well as hard liquor. However, you have to remember that you cannot order hard liquor at the bar, only beer. I prefer a Smithwicks, but next time I go in, I want to try something different. That is what I like about variety, so many choices, which means so many reasons to go back!   They really do not have a daily happy hour, but they have theme nights. Like Thursday is Pub Quiz, you answer ten questions and the winner wins like a $50 bar tab or something along those lines. Our team did not win last night, bummer. They also have $1 draft Sundays at night.   It is a cool place, nothing extraordinary though. Our waitress was hot, but she was a ditz for sure. She forgot all our orders at one point in time and kept forgetting to place them. I guess it has its days of being cool and  lame. It is also awkward when your philosophy professor just so happens to be getting drunk in the same place you are. Got to love this place for the attraction of UNLV faculty.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pub quiz!! Lots of fun!
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Martinis are great!

4a7vR1b0xcrY8mqnVco5uw.text: Final night in Vegas, my friend took me somewhere on the way from BINGO to the strip.  This was the place she chose, as we were NOT going to eat on the Strip another time.    We stopped at Crown & Anchor.  First of all, let me say that I was impressed with the decor.  Being that I have been in London, it was pretty "accurate" with the Pub vibe.  Service was A BIT SLOW, and they were NOT that busy.  However, this seems to be a recurring factor in Vegas.  No one seems to move.  Maybe it is just that I am from the NYC area and like things promptly.  We all ordered salads.  The salads, I must say, are pretty dang tasty for rabbit food.  I was really impressed with it.  The chicken was cooked to perfection and the english dressing was fantabulous.  Prices were NOT that bad.  I would definitely recommend this place, if you have some time to kill & are NOT in a rush to get in, grab something to eat, and run.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lp2RTVbOzKinF-sy1kalIA.text: Holy ass-cheeks, batman! If I wanted a show, I'd go to the strip club. I don't need to know what kind of underwear you are obviously not wearing. Service with a flash, but definitely not IN a flash, waiting 5 minutes and still not even taking a drink order?   I'm sure my husband (along with all the others) really don't mind the show, and honestly, I'm not totally offended, its just not necessary. Showing my husband and I your cooch won't get you better tips, wrong venue for this. Even if I had the body for it, I would never be willing to wear their "uniform".   I've been here before and noticed the skirts were low, dut I don't remember seeing so much butt flesh. Maybe I just wasn't paying as much attention?  Both the hubs and I ordered the fish and chips. We didn't notice until after our meal that Monday's (when we went) are all you can eat fish and chips. I guess that's why the server asked if we'd like another order of fish, but it wasn't made clear that it was a special. Partly our bad for not checking the specials, but also poor service for not informing your customers of the special.   I wasn't overly impressed. The steak fries were decent, though not cooked enough for me. I like a little bit of crunch in my fries, not a mouth full of mush. I guess they thought they'd make up for it in my fish? My first piece of fish was SOOOOO overcooked that there was no resemblance of actual fish in about half of the piece. All the meat was so crispy, I seriously thought it was all breading - until I took a closer look. I could have complained and asked for another piece of fish... had we had anything that resembled service.   I guess I would probably go back sometime to see if anything has changed (I enjoyed the chicken curry the last time I was there - ages ago)... but it's not high on my list of places to spend my hard earned money.

V8BzM4k5i-Do0QrJ0_HAJg.text: Disgusting. We met another couple there for drinks so thankfully my husband and I ate beforehand. About an hour in I saw a cockroach larger than the length of my thumb crawling on the ceiling. I'm talking a Florida sized roach. We had the waitress come take a look and she was like, "oh, they just crawl back in wherever they came from." What?!? This apparently is just a normal occurrence there. It wound up crawling in a little hole near the wooden beams but poked its head out occasionally. And there were also two crickets that were crawling around the beams as well. We got our checks and got out of there.  I would never eat in this establishment nor will I ever be back for drinks. Gross.

3B1jGLp92Tfci71x7Xoo3Q.text: For something different come here...the stereotypical fish and chips were very good and the staff was very friendly!! great beer selection!

KVVlSVNSQlFC2P2IDhMmhQ.text: Update: So I've continued to head to this place in an effort to finish my beer cards. I've managed to finish two cards and am Card No. 3! Tracy has been incredible in knowing which beer to random select for me.  Then again, all of the staff is great and I'm glad they're continuing to provide me with a great experience.

zE1i7YC78RiR0v4AsPetPw.text: I love Crown and Anchor. It's one of my favorite local bars. But it also sucks, in a fun way. Great atmosphere. Fair service. Smoke in your eyes. Horrid food...  I've tried everything but order the fish and chips to feel authentic lol. Stop putting those gross pees on the plate! P.S. They always override my songs on the the jukebox. Don't have them on there then! They aren't cheap.

HxWRpnVNTnCJuqmD50chUA.text: I made my first, but hopefully not last, stop into the C&A Wednesday week whilst on business in LV. It can be difficult at times in a big city to find local hangouts, however I fortunately have a UK mate living here who had already sussed the place out and found it up to his British pub standards. Better yet, as I was staying at the Embassy Suites by UNLV I could easily stroll over and avoid driving. The C&R is basically everything you want in a local pub with an excellent pub atmosphere, a great selection of beers, imported and domestic and a decent pub menu. My friend went for the curry on chips and I played it safe w/ a curry on rice. Although the curry is not quite London or Adelaide fare, none-the-less the dish was more than adequate (I settled for chicken as lamb or seafood were not available), all things considered. I would also prefer to have optionally mild, medium, hot or flaming arse curries served rather than the rather less than mild version served. Additionally a variety of curries such as seafood, lamb and veggie would be a nice touch. With UNLV so close by a curry night would not be out of the question. I was present for an Adelaide pub's (The Exeter) introduction of curry night in 2000, c.f. adelaide.citysearch.com...., an event that remains wildly popular to this day. Not to complain though, all-in-all a great evening of British pints, curry and chit chat. I shall be back.

LcvtsQZTjYznnm069zLyxg.text: The Crown & Anchor is, from the places I've been to, the best pub option in Las Vegas - and I say this as a girl who was born and raised in a bar and lived in Louisiana for several years, where Miller Lite might as well come out of the faucet.  It's a nice, relaxing atmosphere, and you can play pool in a quiet second floor game room if you would rather not be at the bar. It does get pretty crowded on weekend evenings, but the service, food, and beer are still good.  They have a sufficient selection of beers with an emphasis on British beers (obviously, considering it's a British pub; however, if you're a beer snob looking for a wider selection of beer and microbrews then you should go to the Freakin' Frog around the corner).   The negatives for this place are that they have a very small parking lot that often can't accommodate all of their guests, and they are right next to a very dangerous intersection: I've witnessed two car accidents in less than half of a year.  Also, there's no easy way to get here without driving.  The whole point of pubs is that you shouldn't have to drive!  The final, fantastic thing about this place is that it's the only pub I know of in Las Vegas where dogs are allowed (on the outdoor patio, of course)!  I have yet to come across any misbehaving dogs - and fingers crossed it stays that way so they don't get banned!

EeT4dsn3fZ41dcw_oJ2idw.text: What a dump!! I am a Brit in Vegas so I thought I would go to the Crown and Anchor to watch the footie. One end of the bar was covered with stacks of dirty beer glasses. The place was filthy and absolutely minging. The waitress was awful and the food I saw coming out of the kitchen I would not feed to my dog. I left after one pint. Shockingly awful!  I think the worst bar I have ever been in!

L2C2lmf3G10Oa9N-iBWWxQ.text: Stopped by for lunch. It is a small pub. Didn't feel very clean & the chairs had rips in them, the server was working her ass off, she had a huge table she was working on plus us and a few others tables. The wait could have been better. I ordered a coke, it was flat. I ordered the British Burger which I have to say was delicious. Very flavorful & filling. My friend got the pulled pork sliders and she loved them as well. In closing, food is good, service could be better & the dining room could use a little sprucing up.

q4QULGM4gB12dcF2y7vJYg.text: Stilton Plate and Fullers London Pride pale ale...who wouldve thought that just stilton cheese(like blue cheese), cucumbers, and tomato slices would taste so good!! Also the sticky toffee bread pudding was AMAZING! I ordered two...oops ;)

wVoo2hZDN_0OqkbaSQfhsA.text: Here is yet another of my favorite places oh I miss Vegas now. I need to update these reviews when I am there not get back lol!   I love this place sometimes a band great home cooked tasting food, and beer selections and cider and current ohhh.. Out side seating clean and affordable and the darts are supper fun.

pFxCpMF8f2g72JTuthqrKg.text: Carpet has intense odor of beer/other things spilled on it.  If you like microwave frozen food, you'll love it here.  There's something "going on" in this place, like if I found out that there was 400 pounds of marijuana in the basement, it wouldn't surprise me. I think this is a hang out for local residents that are not allowed in casinos.

eoTrXhkWQONmREk31H6Csg.text: Rob is the best bartender and we always have a great time at the Crown!!! They have a great British burger!!! And Rob is so quick with his service when my beer runs low he already has a new fresh ice cold beer ready!!!

bQGV3ZeH-PQA-js7EXizrg.text: I love this place! Its one of the few British Pubs that actually has a whole gang of Brits hanging out all the time. It may have something to do with the constant showing of Rugby and Football matches on the flat screens, or it could have something to do with the 50 or so ale's they have on tap each one being a treat or maybe the pretty tasty english fare on the menu.   I pick all of the above.  I have been here so many times the past 14 years and never been disappointed. The beer is good, the food is delicious.  The atmosphere is lively and fun a great local places, a great place to get something on tap that is actually worth drinking!

a3A71hfRrdCy3oczdlwAVQ.text: I usually love coming to this place, the atmosphere is always fantastic and usually the same applies for the food and.service: but today it was leaving. My bangers and mash was so-so, and while our waitress was nice enough, she had no enthusiasm and we waited for her to come and take our check (which needed to be fixed due to a mistake first), for at least 15 minutes. Not sure I'll be making the trip down here again anytime soon.

_LqxmuZmRAs-z4AlIUdpZQ.text: Stopped by there today for the first time after reading some positive reviews.  Was craving some fish & chips.  Terrible! Frozen battered fish throw in a deep fryer.  Chips weren't even double fried.  Forgot my tartar sauce even though I asked for it when ordering.  Three bites, then covered it with a napkin paid and left. Never again.

utAh8ciCAIlDIdKmBYfnyA.text: So if you have read any of my other posts, I do have a bit of a soft spot for the bar. Well, this place has a bar. They even have this promotion going on where they give you a punch card and you get it punched once for every country you buy a pint from. After 30 punches you get a t-shirt. They neglected to tell me that it needn't be in one night. I am unsure if I got the t-shirt.   I have been here several times other than that faithfull night. I have enjoyed breakfast, simple but solid english breakfast. Lunch and diner were top notch. The bangers and mashare at least as good as my usualpub on Maui.   The kicker is the waitstaff. They always make you feel like a regular. The service at either the tables, the patio, and the bar rivals some of the better establishments on the strip. The naughty schoolgirl thing never hurts either.  Go early in the morning, order a red eye with draught Boddingtons never fails to start the day off right.

AApvnKFmQwoWN94ep_2AQQ.text: I'm going to try to write this without sounding too snooty (I lived in the UK for three years). Great atmosphere, plenty of parking, decent prices, an outdoor pet-friendly patio and a zillion interesting imported beers. The fish and chips was okay, however I'd say it's got nothing on the real thing found in the UK (or even New England). Also, I never knew anyone to wear kilts in England (like the waitresses to here); that's a Scottish thing. I'd be interested to try the Sunday afternoon dinner though!

gyWZUnkM9JT19Wlo59lMTQ.text: First time i have ever done this, but i felt like i had to. I was in town for a week and while here looked online for good places to eat. Crown and Anchor showed up so we decided to give it a try. We came in on Monday night for the all you can eat. First off they need to update their prices online, for the amounts are different. To get on with the story though we walked right in and were able to sit down immediately which was nice. The waitress was at our table within 2 min or so and we ordered beverages and our food right away. My friends water was there within 3-5min or so, my coke however took almost 20 min to show up. After that it took another 20 min for our fish (keep in mind this was AYCE so the fish should be ready quick. After getting our fish, i kid you not it was 40 min before our waitress even stopped back needless to say we had been waiting and trying to ask her for fish for 20min at least. We talk to her and fish is there then somehow within only 5 min. It was then another 20 before we see her again and ask for our check. For anyone that took the time to read this, i really hope that we were an exception and nobody else goes through this. The service as a whole sucked. The people on either side sucked (relationship fighting, and a guy talking in a terrible British accent). In whole dinner took around 2 hours. The reason this even gets 1 star is that yes the Fish and Chips were very authentic. I will not be going back, but if you are willing go ahead and give it a try.

gYKQ8wyhzx-GSVnx1ENXhQ.text: Always  a great place to eat.  I've eaten here numerous times over the years and have had a excellent meal every time.  I've sampled most of the meat pies, and the Fish and Chips are great..  They have a wide selection of beers, the desert menu is good and all in all the service is good.

9KuP-oI419vK1wXHUcppjw.text: The food is great. The service is okay- nothing to write home about. Their late night specials are good. During the day- it is a little pricey.

Xy1_fAagoEMlcGVroy2mvg.text: I've only stopped by here for some drinks with a friend, so I haven't actually tasted the food. My vodka shots were smooth, but I just didn't have any room for food, so instead I just watched my husband and our friend chow down some scottish eggs and fish n' chips.. they loved it. And it's too bad that I wasn't hungry, but service was fast, girls working there were friendly, and seemed like authentic European food.. now I just need to find some place like that here in Arizona..

1lLc6IJrE8lNMET7VVcl2Q.text: Ive been here many many times but the last time I went the bartenders were rude and questioned my ID. I had the fish and chips which were very disappointing, I think joe's crab shack has better fish than crown.

UcP2NKod28EWfcm4eymgOw.text: Pretty good English Style pub. Nice beer selection and they actually have a variety of British Pub food, not just Fish and Chips, but Bangers and Mash, Scotch Eggs, plus a variety of meat pies. Food is good, tasty, the pies are very good, nice gravy, flakey crust. They have a dog friendly patio, although most of the time of year it's either way too damn hot or way too damn cold and windy to sit on it. A big plus to the waitresses, they are all dressed in little plaid skirts and have English accents...very cool.

v1oiIz1xnV1R_DZTuGslVg.text: I love this place! Every time I'm in town I hit it up. Good food, good drinks, and def has that old skool British pub vibe. And I like how they play soccer during football season!

K0SqvNIEE8Eqp9dSBa4UvQ.text: Service was very slow. 20 minutes to brew a pot of coffee. Waitress took our order 5 minutes after delivering the coffee. 10 more minutes to deliver our meal. We both ordered fish and chips. Lots of large fries, lots of green peas, small single piece of fish. The fish was mediocre at best. Crispy breading but virtually  tasteless. In fact quite ordinary. We will not return.

iawq7ky6Is2Cjp7ibzmHEg.text: We Went for Sunday Lunch and they had roast beef and Yorkshire pudding on the menu, but when ever I see Fish N Chips ( fries ) I have to try it out as I try and see who has the best, Crown and anchor Fish N Chips are great, fantastic portion and exactly like Fish N Chips from the UK, only thing I would say is it would be better if it was with Mushy Peas instead of the garden peas they serve but beautiful meal, my Husband had sliders and he could not finish it all, the Food Menu is great some real good British classics and American dishes as well, they have a vast choice of beer ( larger) and spirits and cocktails and even ales on tap, the building reminds me of pubs where I come from Chester in Cheshire England UK, the bar staff are delightful, there is a beer garden and dogs welcome. Toilets could do with a air freshener ( gents) but very friendly atmosphere food and drink great and great price, we are gay and was made to feel welcome, there is Dart boards, TV, Video Poker at the Bar, they do specials all week long, its open 24/7 if your in Las Vegas this is a must come and visit. for British people coming in the USA bar staff and waitresses work for their tips as that is there wage, general rule, when you buy a drink leave a $1 tip per drink, for food leave 20% tip example if your bill is say $50 times the 5 by 2 = $10 there is the tip, if $100 $10-20 if the normal, plus if you like great service next time you go back leave a tip, but the tips is their wage!  we Like this bar and we will be back as we live around the corner. would recommend to every one!

fBDHg6q7RgbCPOsEhVav4w.text: Great fish n chips. Very fresh!  The batter is amazing, nice and crunchy. .it left me wanting another order..

Dz7idipdX7WSl1PqF7khWA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE  1st  time I was here I saw that the waitress's were skinny girls in skirts, and I made the mistake of thinking that these girls were going to be lazy and not care about the fat people sitting in the back. I WAS WRONG... this is one of the hardest working wait-staffs in Vegas, they don't stop moving, and are constantly getting what you ask for. To top it off, they still make you table, no matter how large the amount of the people or how large the people... or both, feel like they are the only Table.  This is the best Fish&chips you will find in this city, I have been looking for years for this quality of fish&chips. The Fish by the way is HUGE and cooked perfectly.  When I come on a Monday, I gain a good 40lbs due to the all you can eat Fish&Chips, then some how stuff a Toffe pudding in my mouth for dessert.

UDiTsGg2MjEociswtDCzog.text: My party of six wanted to enjoy the Super Bowl together and were lucky enough to find this gem. Wonderful assortment of beer. Great menu (Don't leave without having the scotch egg) of traditional faire (better add Yorkshire pudding to your order as well), great service -- the skirts rock too! Thanks again! Hopefully this trip and your restaurant becomes tradition.

18lWjZSRfdgmfgCsKwV01g.text: As any soccer fan living in the United States can attest to, being a fan of The Beautiful Game in this country can be quite a lonely experience.  From the quizzical looks I get when I wear my Cesc Fabregas Arsenal jersey in public, to the "huh?" I get from bartenders at other bars when I ask if they can put a soccer match on, being a soccer fan is sometimes like being the red-headed stepchild.  Which is why I love this place so much.  Simply put, this is the best British Pub I have ever been to.  It isn't a big bar by most standards, but it's very homely and it just feels warm to be inside.  They have pool, darts and foosball for those interested in bar games.  They do have video poker like in most bars these days, but this is a bar better for socializing or watching a match than playing poker.    I just got back today from watching Arsenal play Barcelona in a UEFA Champions League match, and while the place was pretty empty when I got there 20 minutes before match time, practically all the seats were taken by kickoff.  The British Burger I ordered was absolutely delicious, and next time I must try the fish and chips.  Even though it was noonish, the people watching the match were rowdy and fun, and despite the intensity of a hugely important match were for the most part friendly.  While the fans are passionate and intense, you probably don't have to worry about brawls breaking out.  The only bad thing I can say about this place is that the parking lot of quite small and cramped.  If you're going here to watch a match, be sure to get there early, as it fills pretty fast, particularly if it's a popular club or country playing (I.E. Manchester United, Chelsea, Liverpool, Arsenal or England's National Team).  Besides, the smaller lot probably encourages designated driving, so you can experience those many beers and get home safely :)  PROS: -Authentic British pub decor -Wide selection of beers  -Plenty of bar games -Great Food! -Soccer, er, Football fans!  CONS: Small, cramped parking lot.

tG92isZFcxhkeu-EFoTyDQ.text: I've been coming here for over 15 years and I just love it! I've even got the Fiance hooked, too! For a great dessert, try the sticky toffee pudding. =)

ram8GJn8pSy0SQAgOGbnjA.text: Its a cute little british pub with a cute little front patio which is nice on a breezy summer evening. I love to go here while out on a night on the town and stop in for a Pyramid apricot ale along with a scotch egg with some hollandaise sauce. So good!

8DbrB5DsN1R1MEjJZBPEHw.text: I have been visiting the crown and anchor for 10 years and it never fails to be delicious. I have had everything the menu but I always end up ordering the fish and chips repeatedly. Also, this is one of the only places in town that pours Guinness the proper way. Thanks and I'll be back for at least another 10. Cheers!

KrBcdkJB3HVjnN-kfsHbWg.text: My boyfriend and I went to this place for the first time after talking about wanting to go for years. It is a really laid back pub with English decor and nice waitresses.
