We both ordered onion rings to start and then an order of fish and chips. The onion rings were huge with crispy batter making it the biggest onion rings I've ever seen. The fish and chips were awesome too, just what I expected. The waitress forgot to mention to us before we got the onion rings that Mondays are all you can eat fish and chips day, otherwise we would have eaten more. My boyfriend is a big beer fan and said he liked their beer menu! Overall, I really like this place! Remember, fish and chips are all you can eat on Mondays!!

YMJdz1S_Fh6qrzRSKhhnYQ.text: Still loving Crown & Anchor.   As a Vegas-native now living in the UK I can say that Crown & Anchor is definitely the closest experience to an English pub I have ever seen in Vegas. Such a great place to just sit around, drink some beer, eat some food (curry! scotch egg! pies! bangers!) and not be rushed or expected to hurry, eat, leave.  Find yourself a nice quiet corner, bring the newspaper, order a beer and a bowl of stilton cabbage soup and laze the day away. As stated before avoid evenings and weekends if you dont want to run into the lame college crowd.

FtDjks9Qn04dGwcADxIZHA.text: The Crown makes better chicken curry than a Pakistani grandma! Get it over a bed of rice or if you have a strong heart it's delicious over fries.   Join the "Down the Hatch Club" by drinking every beer they have on tap. It's a great way to try new brews and keep track of your alcoholism.  Every Thursday night is quiz night so get some friends together or go solo and make new ones to win the ultimate prize($50 bar tab).  The juke box is digital so it can be hit or miss but if someone plays really bad music the bartenders will override it. The dart boards are in great shape and the loft has Foosball for all my Mormon friends.   If you're a video poker player the bar is great, if you're not there's a ton of places to sit.

oNOqAjA_uhE-S2HUAsMGqQ.text: I came here when I would go to UNLV, this place is a good place to hang out if you need to kill 2 or more hours in-between classes, they have big screen TVs everywhere and the food isn't that bad.

vXv76HctzMg1vVy4Wsmd0Q.text: So it's a pretty good English-y tavern, augmented with Vegas' love for gambling.  But if you don't sit at the bar proper, you can barely tell any of that's there.  There's a few TVs up to watch a match, lots of beer on tap (the English assortment of 1664 and Carlsburg), and you can order a large baseball of meat wrapped in a buttery shell.   Oh wait, that's a Cornish Pastie!  And it's delicious.    Did I mention the wait staff is hot?

0Gs-wUJSrwzTMs-kE5zcAw.text: For years me and family members have driven past here and have always wanted to try the experience. I pretty much guessed beforehand going into this that the place would be a little divey since after all it's a pub, however I wasn't prepared for how my meal here went. Walking up to the entrance you see their patio area for pets which I think is a cute idea but then seeing the grass having huge divots and holes with standing water in them going stagnant made me feel like I would never want my dog to visit here. Then came walking inside. We waited to be seated since there is a sign kindly requesting you wait to be helped, well waiting we did, then waiting some more & some more which felt strange since there was only maybe 10 other guests there tops. The hostess was kind, I was surprised to see how hiked up her skirt was but again I thought "well this is a pub in Las Vegas" so I wasn't upset. She was kind enough to take our drink orders and return with them a short time later, when she came back she took our meal orders: bangers & mash and fish & chips. We then waited a long time to see the hostess/waitress again it was about 40 minutes for our food, which wouldn't have been a big deal if the food we got back was hot and appetizing. The bangers & beans were Luke warm and the mash was cold with cold gravy where it's more like meat flavored jello than gravy. The fish & chips were okay in the sense that yes it's fried and a huge piece of fish but I wasn't expecting it to be soaked in oil when I received it and the side of peas appeared fine until I watched a small fly crawl out of them and fly away. Trying to make the best of it with my guest we decided to have the food be taken away and we dared enough to try dessert which was probably the only thing we did enjoy. The things I failed to mention through out this review is that while sitting there the entire time we really took in how filthy the place is with holes in the wall, dirty light switches and scuffs everywhere and creaky filthy floors & A LOT of spider webs everywhere A LOT. The tables are spaced out about 2 ft apart which wasn't a big deal, but my prior mention of the hostesses uniform made it uncomfortable when she bent over to fix up the table next to us which was also odd considering the place setting I was seated at was already dirty from someone else eating on it. I think the worst part of all was leaving their one way parking lot and seeing the back door being held wide open with a rope, immediately all of my food handling knowledge & certifications kicked into high gear knowing that open doors are a EXTREME no no because it allows pests of all kinds directly in. All & all its not a place I would go back to and it made me feel awful that I actually invited someone to join me without checking it beforehand, I won't be returning & nothing could make me desire too. So much more happened but I'm done talking about it. I dined in on 10/10/15 around 2:45pm

e9i9y7A1KmaDooc6ki1u_Q.text: The bartenders are all easy to talk to, and they treat you right. The beer selection is pretty great, and the food is as well. They show Premier League and MLS matches as well as other American leagues. The atmosphere is what really gets me to come in, and everyone is friendly, even the customers. I highly recommend this for anyone looking for an authentic pub atmosphere.

YvIyUp3QC2gsNR2yvUd5ug.text: They have british pub food...I mean REAL british pub food. Chip buttys!!!!!! Scotch eggs, lots of beer, and its pretty decent...Its not my favorite watering hole in the area as sometimes the bartenders can be shit heads, and you cannot do shots at the bar?? wtf! But if you are jonesing something greasy and british, like russel brand, then go here

OL3xDWPPXkZz_TyRhg4ing.text: Went here with my wife for lunch and had a great time.  I wanted a british beer so I just told the waitress to surprise me and that she did.  It was excellent.  I ordered the fish and chips and was not disappointed.  HUGE chunks of fish and it was light and flaky and I enjoyed the heck out of it.  My wife on the other had ordered a lamb stew that was very very lamby, and I love lamb but when I tasted it, it made me jerk my head.  I had that lamb smell in my nose so I had to chow down on my fish and vinegar goodness.  It was fun though.

2wy4td72JTQFxdXfBAiTbA.text: I have repeatedly had the worst service in all of Vegas here. Unless you're sitting at the bar gambling, be prepared to wait: wait to order, wait for your drink, wait for your food, and wait for the bill. This last time wasn't so bad, however the time before that we had to wait for our server to finish taking pictures of herself with some other dude that worked there to get our bill. The food and drink is GREAT (scotch egg is top notch and the tender peas served as a side with many dishes a great comfort food to me), but the consistently poor service has finally eclipsed it. Bummer.

FDWa1Om0Db1UfC0SXFeQgQ.text: I had to give 2 stars based on my latest experience.  3 of us stopped by for Saturday morning breakfast at 9:30am today and encountered a lady bartender who could not have been more rude.   The bar/pub had 7 customers - four at two tables and three at bar.  We waited for five minutes to be seated (per the sign) and when she didn't acknowledge us, I asked if we could grab one of the 8-10 empty tables.  She asked us to wait and went on doing paperwork and tidying up behind the bar.  After another 5 minutes we decided to leave.  C&A needs to talk to their staff or get friendlier people.  I gave two stars because I remember how good the food used to be!

uVxxLf8xq9EJY7dSPLty2A.text: Bridget was simply amazing and patient.  It was a busy morning and she handled the bar on her own while Manchester U played.  Super busy shift and she served us, party of four, with class. I ordered one of two favs...fish and chips. Live this place.

Ob67a0zoHCI3Cf1_bQjAkA.text: I love going to True pubs and reminiscing of pastimes in Ireland or Scotland with a pint and some good hearty food! I used to go to this pub two years ago but when I went about two months back, sad to say the quality of food was a pass! Subpar in taste. I usually have the fish and chips but my friends had ordered other dishes in which they also were unimpressed with or didn't even want to finish. The worst was the Sticky Toffee that was composed of a small dry tasteless muffin with some heated caramel on it. Honestly, I wouldn't waste my time nor money here as I would go to much better places like RiRa at Mandalay Bay or Auld Dubliner at Lake Las Vegas for the best food, drink for the authentic pub experience!

0hS9a57nL2qBTWoZCJBB2A.text: Grated cheese on a 7 dollar ceaser do no croutons made me long for the time on the rack.  Sorry this is not a hard salad to make and it has just a tiny number of ingredients if you can't get that right I don't think I will be back.  Richard it was about two weeks ago.

MPxfJceL-LQZDI1LuIm8Yw.text: Was out riding on the motorcycle. Stopped by for the 1 beer I'm allotted. Had the Fish & Chips. I usually stop by every month or so.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stopped by for the allotted 1 Pint while riding on the Motorcycle. Tasted GREAT!

DL8SthSWvfkjQYfjpOtMOg.text: Wow just want to thank everyone at Crown and Anchor for the outstanding service and quality of food that was provided to me ( had the steak and mushroom pie). I especially want to give a shoutout to Tasia who was amazing and provided excellent service as a server. I'll definitely be back soon.

9_PzLj1cfkuKTKLeCCQh6Q.text: Says open 24 hours. Went in for breakfast as they had advertised good breakfast somewhere. It smelled like a rank, spicy fart inside. There was only 1 person in the whole place, playing video poker. Unsure if they worked there or not (I don't think they did). No one showed to seat us. After waiting a while, just left because we couldn't take the smell anymore.

MSkfXI90_9ONx1yw6X-NLg.text: Worse service ever they lack waitresses and take forever to take your order and drinks. The bartender needs to chill on his attitude and stop using his phone I believe his name was Jason.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rcS5J-4uhazrDBbqzlyfjg.text: A Vegas gem. The Crown is the place to meet up with friends, great atmosphere, good selection of brews and by far the best chicken fingers around.

jI0hmACyhUAq47Kfo-5P8g.text: Best authentic pub in Vegas!!! Food is absolutely fantastic with large portions and reasonably priced. Will be a regular there. Highly recommend!!

S-kEqc0UIW7h0kC6djVojQ.text: It has been quite awhile since we have eaten here. Even though the food was always good we never liked the fact that they didn't have a True non smoking section. The restaurant is non smoking but is adjacent to a bar where smoking is allowed and there is no separation between the two. If I can smell it and need to shower when I get home than it is not non smoking in my book. That is not my complaint however, I knew what I was getting into there. My complaint is about the service.  We waited a longer than acceptable time to order. We were all pretty hungry and some of us ordered the pies which we are aware take longer than the average entree so we ordered a cup of soup in addition. Our server was either absent or darting by so fast we couldn't get her attention between when we ordered and our food came out. Several of our drinks were dry and those of us who ordered soup were wondering if it had been forgotten. In addition a couple of us wanted to order something from the bar but gave up on that idea. The soup did came out with the entrees and when I commented that I had expected it quite awhile ago the server just said that the kitchen put everything out at one time.  Now I am not naive or self centered enough to think that they made a special pot of soup for me so I am not sure what was so difficult about ladling it into a cup, or more importantly why she didn't check on it when it didn't come up very shortly after the order had been placed. I was not expecting a grand gesture but a simple apology would have sufficed. To add to that our glasses sat empty until my husband stood up and called her back and requested refills.  The food itself was pretty good. The stilton and cabbage soup is excellent and the steak and mushroom pie is very tasty if not a little sparse on filling, especially for the price. The mashed potatoes were the one bleak spot of the dinner, not even warm and hardened as if they had sat out for too long. So overall, pricey for what it is and service seems to be pretty spotty. Not enough to entice me back to contend with the smoking aspect.

7Tc0hhyxCpcbnvt9dJTu2w.text: Very pleasant time at this place. Came on a Sunday night early evening, light crowd. Excellent chicken curry as others have mentioned (if I had to guess I'd say the mushrooms are actually cooked fresh and not just out of a can), let it sit for a bit to cool off, tastes better this way. Bartender, Brian, was great, very attentive to everyone yet made time for some interesting conversation. The GM (friendly British lady) checked on me a few times and seemed to appreciate feedback. Lastly, wonderful atmosphere, like a long log cabin!  No loud music or televisions either, will be back!

i6WV11sPKHh7dR3-Y127IQ.text: You'd think I'd come to a pub and order fish and chips, right? Wrong! I ordered a delicious chicken curry and my date had chicken strips. When we entered, we were not greeted and after waiting for ten mins, I reached over the counter, grabbed two menus and we seated ourselves. After we sat down, a waitress noticed us and came over, took our drink orders and then checked back with us to get our food orders. Drinks came out about fifteen minutes before the food and when the food arrived it was piping hot and delicious. Place is a little dark (it's a bar), and most of the patrons stand around drinking and talking like some bar scene from a cheesy sitcom, but all in all, a great place for late night Eats.

MrOVs4Ec1qNlVPaPkJbZ2A.text: I have never been to England to see what a real British Pub is like, but I very much hope it is like this one.  For an appetizer, my party shared a "Giant Yorkshire Pudding".  My mother had a British boyfriend when I was young and she made him Yorkshire pudding. This one was better than some I've had, but not as good as "Mom used to make". But since those weren't authentically "Authentic" it's tough to deduct points for it.  They got cold quick, but that was probably because of the "Giantness"   Probably the best Scotch Eggs I've ever had are here. And you can get them cold OR warm (I personally recommend warm).  I also had the Fish and Chips (Since I was going for "The Classic" British Style) and they were good.  Just one fish, but it was a pretty big fillet, so no complaints.  We finished it off with Sticky Toffee Pudding which was great!  Through all of this, the ONE waitress kept on top of a pretty busy place.  Considering she was the only one waiting tables her performance was extraordinary. Though as an understandable side effect, service was a bit slow and a member of the party never got the coffee she ordered with the Pudding.  I wish I was in Vegas more often so I could stop in more often. I do hope to come back the next time I'm in town.  One other side note.. They do have a "Pet Friendly Patio" so you can bring your pet for a meal outside.  (PS: Due to some drunkenness, I checked in twice.  I've only been here once. The second check in is wishful thinking. Unless it is very far in the future and I've been here more than twice.  In which case, subtract one)

opIQdzJHZxDs178bPWEJNw.text: Don't try ordering a mixed drink at the bar their liquor license won't allow it unless you have food in front off you. Weird right?

4c_YZSCuFCTBfY5eigc9HQ.text: Love that you can bring your dog! I need to next time. Great fish and chips! My boyfriend and I split  it and we were stuffed from just half each!  Decent beer selection. Good service.  I dig it.

IjmAa8Ex_UEUlwpI6WGzNA.text: Came here for lunch and to watch an NFL game. This is definitely a soccer bar, but the bartender Bridget was super nice and put on an American football game. In fact, she was the best bartender I've encountered in years. Very funny and engaging. The food was good for a pub, and the beer selection had lots of excellent British options in addition to a serviceable American menu of good IPA's including Dogfish Head 90 minute on tap. They played great 80's music with many obscure New Wave songs. I love this place and wish it had a branch back home.

VCayT06Cir3AawDWpq0NRQ.text: WARNING: This is NOT an Arsenal bar. I got information about this as an "Arsenal bar" from Arsenal.com and decided to go on North London Derby day. You know, the day you'd expect the best Arsenal atmosphere... The place was split 50/50 with Spuds fans and the TV situation was lame. The food was okay but I was strictly attending because of Arsenal, so I'm forced to let everyone know. I'm giving this place three stars as to not skew their rating, but I felt like I had to warn my fellow Gooners. Three ***

H-Th_kqbEafoMUwxbynFPA.text: I can say this is probably one of my new favorite places. I came across this place by sheer luck when I was craving some sort of shepherds pie and didn't feel like driving up to the Irish pubs I frequent in town. "English people eat that shit too!" I told myself as I made an illegal u-turn in the middle of Tropicana. (ok no I didn't but it adds to the story right?)  The place has a really cool set up, there's a restaurant and bar area, and also a dart board (for the not too rowdy) The bartender Adam (I think?) was really nice and was ready to explain anything on the menu we had questions about. The good service continued the second time I had returned here, the waitresses are friendly and quick with orders.   I'm the type of person that likes to eat a crapton of food while I drink, cause I'm a fat bastard, and the delicious food here is more than enough for me to get my fill. The cottage pie is probably my favorite thing on their menu, along with plenty of Yorkshire pudding and gravy sauce. I'm getting hungry just typing this. I told you I was a fat bastard.

W9cPPw_qSj-nU7xkJLggHg.text: I'm so glad we made it out to the Crown & Anchor.  Unfortunately the place doesn't look like much from the outside, but it was a real treat.  Great service, great food, great drinks, awesome prices.  It's a pub, so go into it with that in mind.  Happy hour draught  drinks!  I grew up on English food, and this meal reminded me of that.  Yorkshire pudding, with butter, gravy &/or honey-butter, to die for!  While we didn't have room, we still ordered the apple-crumble for dessert, and I'm glad we did.  Warm custard/pudding, with apple, and crumble, a real treat to end the meal.  Wish I had discovered this place earlier in our trip, as I would have frequented them more often.

dvxu_uPp9PuUz27g37zYtw.text: Stopped in on the way back from the Pinball Hall of fame for a quik beer and irish car bomb..cool vibe, old school English pub. Keri our waitress was great. We'll definetly stop in next time in town.

gqLdKmwaJDbdqktM1op7lA.text: Always stop here in my visits through Vegas. Nice place for a beer and an English brekkie. Staff are friendly food is good and beer selection is great. It's off the strip so the prices are good. Footy on the tele in a Saturday morning so you can sit with other supporters and have a good time.

Nqv4fkE-0dE2R-q6-Wwhgg.text: This was a great English Pub.  We were looking for steak, but found this.  Excellent fish and chips.  All home made fish and chicken fingers.  Good service.

wNB0lKAiQWT6MVr2iRy-6w.text: Wow I used to love this place. I just went there and it took me 25 minutes to get my first drink 30 minutes to get my food 20 minutes for each round of beverages and it took me 45 minutes to get my bill at the end , come on...... I think it is because I was not sitting at the bar , I was sitting at one of the few slot machines on the side. Everyone at the bar was getting fast service . The bartenders were either neglecting the waitresses or the waitress that I had just forgot to put in my orders... I dunno!!  Richard it was the same day I arrived there at around 9 PM

f4DvOUJ1x_gv0laLDX0LRw.text: Huge fan of the Crown & Anchor!  Come here for darts!  Come Here for English Pub Ales on Tap!  Come here for Soccer matches!  Come here for a  Scotch Egg!  You can even come for an English Breakfast or Sunday Dinner...they will both suffice, but I can't truly rave about either.  And you can certainly come with friends for a good time!  The food is solid (Fish & Chips / Pub Style Curry...and I'll mention the Scotch Egg yet again!) but not worth coming here for by itself.  The Beer is mostly English & Irish Favorites...more than the average pub, but not everything a beer snob is looking for...again not a sole reason for the average Joe to come here.  But when you include the British Pub atmosphere, I'm sold!  I want to be in a place that feels different than average Vegas.  I want to play darts a few times a year...so I will return again and again, have a great time, enjoy some food and beer and remember the special nights when the world just seems more right...and I'll do that here in a heartbeat!   A little more attention to their food and I'd be handing out 5 stars with a smile!

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anyone for a pint?

9IV8wdC-exnsKkjQVDy2wA.text: We went here for lunch before heading to the pinball game room just a couple of blocks away. To our surprise it was packed. We had wonderful food and good beer. I would recommend the scotch eggs. Very nice

jw7_zEyx55M9pOyPmqVdoQ.text: Thank you for reaching out, Richard. To be clear, we love bartender Leslie. We loved her as a server. This person was someone else.  Last week I was in at 1:30 in the afternoon. Prior to that, twice, was lunchtime.  Both times were week days around noon and the restaurant side (and patio) were pretty full. Your Stilton burger is the best thing ever, as are the pasties. No doubt we'll give Crown & Anchor another try. Thank you again.

l2m0Hb0RnJmqVSNZSH0Xsg.text: Great selection of beers on tap.  Sarah was our bartender and greeted us promptly when we approached the bar.  We enjoyed a couple of Boddingtons and Stellas throughout the evening while playing the jukebox and darts.  Love the layout of the bar and the dart area.  Only thing stopping me from giving a perfect rating was the condition of the left dart area.  The wall has a hole beneath the dart board and a fellow patron lost a dart through it and was unable to play anymore since there was only one set of darts available.

yiCnPSdxcdRXt7Nr2NPjnQ.text: Fiance and I came in tonight for dinner. First time here. We both work in the restaurant industry , one of us being in upper management, so we rarely have the same nights off together.  They are known for their fish and chips so we tried that, the sausage roll appetizer, and the toffee cake which was all delicious! Our server Nicole was awesome and very social. She made us feel very welcome and checked on us often. I would definitely come back :)

wjteUH2rh2QpeHTE9zlG2w.text: I love this place. Food is consistent and the service is spot on. I'm there about once a week after work and Jessica always greets me with a smile. She's a big reason why I continue to come back. The rest of the team there is great as well.   The beer selection is solid and the food portions are generous. Plus soccer is always on which is a nice bonus.   Enjoy the Crown.

o5UppcYzpmJb6bR-CuarfA.text: I'm losing my respect for Yelp if people think this place is 3.5 stars. Definitely the worst food I have had in Las Vegas. Everything frozen and oily.....onion rings, fish and chips ( supposedly their signature dish) talk about a place that needs a bar rescue this is it. Best thing I can say is the beer was good and the waitress was delightful.

6XcwH0iSbVPTPYVDmhemDg.text: Don't get me wrong I love a good dive But this was just ok. Nothing terrible but you can typically get most of the items in any generic "pub." My friend that I went with didn't care for the fish and chips. I got mozzarella sticks and they were ok. My fiance enjoyed the fries though. It was fair price wise but I wouldn't make a point to return. The service was standard.

XZoPySJXm7KbayYLOVA-TA.text: Can't rave enough about the staff and the Bartender Rob and the sweet waitresses! They even have #Glutenfree #DedicatedFryers and omg if ever gluten allergy person isn't compelled to come here at least once a week for the best GF steak fries, then they're all crazy!

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #GlutenFree Burger a &amp; #GlutenFreeFries -bartender Rob! dedicated fryer &amp;have awesome glutena-free steak fries 2die4 &amp; not get sick!!!

qfrHfM0TQs9zkSvUtUAW0w.text: This place is one of our favorites! We have been here a ton of times over the years and it always lives up to our expectations!!! The soup is amazing blue cheese (Stilton) Yummy!!! I always get this! I tried the chicken fingers this past time they are awesome!!! We have tried many dishes here and there is not one thing that we would not get again. They have outside seating for when the weather is warmer. It can get pretty busy here, Especially with the University being so close. The bar area can get pretty packed at certain times. We have always hit it pretty lucky and never had too long of a wait. We highly recommend this place especially if your going to get some British food. Its really good! Worth checking out!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stilton Soup (Blue Cheese) So good!
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Chicken Fingers!!!
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i_jaJu30kW6OR0b24vjDPA.text: Every year my annual trip to Vegas includes a trip to the Crown and Anchor British Pub. They have a large selection of Beers and Play your $20.00 slots and get a free lunch (which taste great) and drinks! I will stay and play for a couple of hours. If you like soccer, They have special events for that too!.

UF75LmnMSb7pE7k1QCVEkA.text: Came in at Happy hour ordered the fish and chips and was was charged 13.95. Then I check the online menu price and it 10.95. Ordered a Guiness 6.00 happy hour price.  Needless to say I was ripped off. Will not be coming back. I will spread the news far and wide. Service was good. And a well poured pint.  You do realize on the strip at 9 fine Irishman happy hour pint 5.00. Happy hour food cheaper.  Really disappointed.

OJhazAP4BNfvq8BWFUpHPw.text: If you like good beer and need a place to watch a sporting event (Easily the best place to watch soccer matches in town), then you've come to the right place. Nothing spectacular for food. I tried the chicken fingers based on other reviewers suggestions and I would say they're a little better than your average. They give you hot sauce with them, which is probably why they were good. I would rate their game day atmosphere a 5 but the food a 3.

s6z6yKh9R5RnQIEMwIRqGg.text: My favorite is the lamb stew in a Yorkshire pudding with strawberry ale but the steak and mushroom pie is awesome too. Hubby likes the bangers with mash but the Scottish eggs are by far our mutual must have order on every single visit!

qnov8Ox9MMsfDsIkEzpI8w.text: This is a great spot with lots to offer and good, traditional food and beer. Personally, the beer cocktails tend to have my heart here. And let's not forget about the classic fish and chips. The chicken fingers are pretty tasty too. And if you're into meat pies, there are some good ones here.   The service is always friendly and fairly attentive. Parking can be tight when it's crowded. The bar area is nice. The restaurant area is ho-hum, but not cramped.  They have karaoke one night of the week, trivia one night of the week, etc. So there's always something going on here. While close to UNLV, it's definitely not too much of a college crowd.  I tend to be here more often for lunch than anything else. Lunch here is fab as it's usually practically empty.  All in all, probably the best British pub in Vegas.

VQ1IjdP_rL0nNWepsGU28A.text: Jeessica and Bridget were my server and beer tender.   OMG.  Amazingly friendly.   Great food.  Atmosphere was great and you cant go wrong with these 2 ladies serving you all afternoon

4AQ12nLDQ-gvtnzcVCLrRg.text: Awesome service, cold beer and best fish and chips ever....   Great deal for lunch - toss $20 in the machine and get lunch w a beer!  Machines are pretty generous and always have football (soccer,) games on!

3DzPsRgIpMJN1zPQiMD0_A.text: RUDE MANAGER. We (7 out of town guests) stopped there before a UNLV basketball game because it was recommended. We got SLOW service on a Saturday afternoon. When the manager said she would take care of it by comping our drinks (2nd round, waitress forgot one, then never brought it) she fooled me by charging my bank card anyway, without my signature!! Not the customers fault they only had one waitress on a game day. I will NEVER go back!!!!!! I will however call my bank.

oAVsdE3JpIofPtP7pBAfpA.text: I was expecting something out of Austin Powers but felt like I could have been at a bar at a beach in San Diego.  I was there on a Friday night and it was busy but not butts to nuts like you'd find at a place on the strip.  The beer is a little pricey.  $5.50 for a Newcastle, but this is Vegas.  Parking is a little cramped but I got lucky and got a good spot just as another guy pulled out.  They had a dj playing songs off an apple laptop and he was playing a good mix of stuff.  Made me feel like I was back in college when he put on Crazytown.  When you're here, check out the upstairs area where you can kick back with some pool.  Another interesting note about the Crown and Anchor is the it's the hangout of choice for boxer Ricky Hatton when he fights in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZlMsw28gcutDIo_JW5RghA.text: I've been coming here off and on for the last six years. On my 21st this was the second stop on my drinking around the university tour. I got to witness a hilarious argument in which a biologist had a drink thrown in his face by a mean drunk lady.   If you like to watch football (soccer), this is the place to be. They do have a cover charge on occasion; I guess that is for pay per view games or something.  On those occasions when I'm a crappy vegetarian and eat fish (I admit it), the fish and chips here are the best I've had in Las Vegas.

IchG05838ZGt782iAYXzNQ.text: Love this spot, always have a great time going here, sooooo many great beers on tap and love playing darts!!

vb2obwneVHRtj_POAS1peA.text: I just came here for lunch had 2 smithwicks but not before having chicken fingers. I asked them to make them as hot as they can possibly make it which still isn't it hot enough for me, none the less they are amazing. I also had the garlic sauteed mushrooms in lu of french frys. Please try them, they will brighten your day, way better than french frys.

ebEiYsLJ1YDOea6iGIIUSw.text: Okay.  So my wife and I pull into the auto glass repair shop to get my driver's side window replaced (some &*^%&# broke it and stole about $600 of stuff from my car).  While waiting, we started looking for a place to eat and found this place.  Crown and Anchor is an AUTHENTIC English pub, right down to the kidney pie and the smoky atmosphere.  It was great comfort food--at that time we needed some comfort and this place served up some great food and drink.  We could have done without the smokiness, but that was a small price to pay for a good meal.  Highly recommended.

z1LPz_wvxPp3wDAhiQpmnA.text: Stopped in for the Monday night AYCE Fish & Chips special. Was bummed to learn that clam chowder wasn't on the menu every night. Would have loved to have had some. Fish was good but seemed that the outside was fried too much as there were hard crispy pieces that you didn't want to eat (in the fryer too long). Fish itself was flaky & not dried out. Not a fan of the peas that accompanied the dish. Chips were good as well.

Zi8yErstlzwtAgR5YkTCMA.text: Weve been going to vegas for 15 years and just discovered this place last wrek. We went specifically for the fishn chips because the fish weve been getting at Ellis island is so greasy!  Our fish was delicious! We just got one piece but it was a big ass fat piece crispy, lightly battered and most delicious. Steak fries were yummy and they have what tasted like the make it yourself ranch dressing, yum! Peas had no seasoning but not a big deal salt and pepper were right there on the table! Our server Tracy was fantastic and treated us well, we will most definately be back. They also have Pepsi products as most places do when you get off the strip. Well done Crown, well done. Now if they would just take down those redskin banners...Lol

WwQUDuVcOmqZD-KewU5_hQ.text: Sorry but you are in VEGAS and I have to go to a table and order food to be served liquor? We had just had a great dinner and great drinks elsewhere, decided we wanted to go have a few drinks and some fun. Found this place, went up to the bar ordered a round of Jamisons which we were told we could only have if we had a table and ordered food. Ended up having a round of beer and leaving with a very very unhappy date.

Xlirk5uI5eThFsOJpTUJOg.text: My favorite place to watch the Arsenal... come on you gunners. Specials every Tuesday and Wednesday. Food is good, service is great, atmosphere amazing.

XtE30pf33HuQcfLUE44D-Q.text: In a town where $10 beers are now the new norm, this is a great oasis in the desert. Best of all, the patrons are mostly local.    I recently enjoyed several Delirium Tremens there, just one of the many unique bottled choices C&A offers, and I was seeing pink elephants.   The food is not bad, but go here for the beer.   Nice tap selection also.

azgrPkXjX9EEtqaXwNPB2Q.text: The service is usually terrible, but it's such a fun place. They have real cork dart boards and great beer on tap. Go Monday for the all you can eat fish and chips.

nuepS1Ny--XWsobdBybbIQ.text: You would have to be white or be with a white person to get good service around here.  I felt a racial tension when I was here last.

photos.caption: Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm...beer!
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown on a Thursday Night
Photo of Crown & Anchor British Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown food (Curry Chicken with Fries and Rice) and Meat Pie.

Wx7W8BqL-sJ8kasiF9C9QQ.text: Love the fish and chips here.  It's my go to place when I want a quiet break from work during lunch.  The service is always friendly and the food is great.  Maybe someday I'll venture to the bar :)

G4GZ0I5X_ivk1tZTMXB-Gw.text: Went to watch the Rebel game.  We started with chicken fingers - crispy crunchy excellence!  Next up was the Steak and Mushroom Pie. The steak and mushrooms were waiting below the buttery crust in a delicious sauce.  Love the atmosphere at Crown and Anchor.  The service was great even though they were busy for the LV Weekly event.  And with over 30 choices on draught - you can't go wrong!

q5VcZcgYpBoBF6Sl_QxXhg.text: Went here last night and did not have an enjoyable experience. After waiting for more than ten minutes to be acknowledged at the bar I was yelled at by the WWE looking "bartender" for trying to order a vodka cran. He abruptly yelled "no, you can't have that. We only do wine and beer at the bar."  Fair enough, but post a sign or be nice explaining that to your customers. Especially when you are working for tips. Also, the interior is completely run down and disgusting.

OVwoHGkW5uGNXK0NBy3ORw.text: A good pub is a wonderful place. Done right, it's a second home for those of us that like to bend an elbow.  Now, Vegas doesn't have a perfect pub.  The main problem in our city is that every pub ruins its ambiance by installing those damn video poker machines in the bar.  And part of the greatness of a pub is a spacious wooden bar (uncluttered by anything except empty pints). So in Vegas, we already start a star down (try resting your elbow on the bar with those blocky video poker machines in the way).  But when you lower the bar for Vegas, Crown & Anchor is an excellent choice.  They have a solid selection of British, Irish and American beers and a decent whiskey collection.  Add in a nice dart board and a solid crowd of good-humored patrons.  Head there for a big soccer match or rugby match and you'll find a nice batch of rowdy fans yelling at a television.  It's comfortable and fun, with tasty fried food and drinks.  What you'd expect from a good pub.  And there are some advantages to drinking in a Vegas pub.  Like all successful Vegas businesses, Crown & Anchor has perfected the art of hiring sexy wait staff.  The staff is very easy on the eyes and a vast improvement from the brown teeth and rolly-polly figure you'd find in jolly ol' England.

w33AkmHACyPEgdwskbOufw.text: Need a local spot for darts? This is your place! My favorite locals pub in the city. Always an interesting group of people. The service is great, Nicole is the hottest waitress in Vegas :) Great beer selection.   If you go I will suggest Wednesdays for karaoke night- half of the singers verge on professional and the other (like me) are pretty bad but always choose good songs.   Thursdays are Pub Quiz nights- although you often have to translate what the quiz reader is asking (very thick British accent) it's a good time and winner gets a $50 bar tab, which, unfortunately, you cannot use the same evening.   TV's are generally tuned into soccer or rugby...I wouldn't know but I hear they get some big crowds at 8AM for important matches.  Interesting liquor license at this place- I mean who wants liquor at a British pub and with their wide variety of beers but if you want a shot you've got to be sitting in the "restaurant" not the bar.  Get the chicken fingers they are better than the fish and chips! Open 24 hours this place is the best for after hours! I HEART THE CROWN!

E_xKuwLpiWGbSOb9_vzdRw.text: Had lunch today.  Fish and chips. Great bar service with a pretty lady with an awesome personality.   Games are good and a very  wide choice of draft beers.  Plenty of tv's.  Love it!

skkv46o2VdJu0q51MRUwOw.text: Great spot for lunch with a pint. And they have a doggie friendly patio. I will be bringing Shadow with me next time!

Hpf0JggHQSeeUH6fYz-9-Q.text: Ugh!  So we had to take a cab to get here because we didn't want to have to trek down Tropicana Avenue ten blocks only to get rolled.  Once we got there we realized something horrifying:  the air conditioner was BARELY on!  Then to make matters even worse NOBODY took our order for a good TEN MINUTES while we sat there (yes, I DID keep track, thank you!)...  So why the HELL would I give such a lame place four stars?  Probably 4.5 to be exact?  Because C&A is just what I miss about London and definitely lived up to high expectations!  Decor is wild.  Definitely reminded me of the drunken stumbles around Notting Hill during World Cup '06.  It felt VERY pub-esque and I loved it so much.  Beer selection is...  eh?  Well let's just say that if you love them English-style beers then you're in heaven.  It was hard to break from the black and tans (especially for hopheads like my brother and myself) so we didn't -- which was fine.  LOTS of weekly specials...  Kind of makes me wish I was either a UNLV student or a casino industry worker.  Or that at least I lived around here to make it out for their occasional food and drink specials.  Or at least to be able to enjoy soccer (sorry, but there is already another sport in this country called 'football' ... TM Justin Timberlake @ the ESPYs) on the numerous TVs.  But the food, jeez, the FOOD!!!  Fish and chips.  Cod was fried EXACTLY the way we love it -- and my bro and I BOTH agreed that it's way better than the Olde Ship's (British pub-ish place here in Orange County) fish.  Thin, crispy outside, flaky yumminess of fish on the inside.  Tartar sauce was perfect.  Fries were perfect.  We chose to throw most of the peas into my chicken curry.  Speaking of which...  chicken curry!  Kind of what I expected -- not spicy, good flavor -- but soooo much food!  I chose to order it on the rice since my brother already had chips.  Good call.  Perfect consistency in the potatoes, LOVED the mushrooms, chunks of chicken were a good size.  It was just SO FILLING!  The night's ultimate experience, however, came in the form of an impromptu "Today's Special" dessert:  the sticky toffee pudding was proudly displayed on the night's chalkboard.  Sooo...  what were we to do?  And DEAR GAWD did we make an excellent decision.  The toffee sauce is TO DIE FOR.  I absolutely despise raisins but I stuffed them in my mouth as far as this culinary sinfulness was concerned.  Bread pudding-ish + buttery toffee moat + whipped cream + raisins = one of the most delightful sweets I'd EVER had in my life!  We were so stuffed we couldn't even order another beer.  We were so food comatose that we had to get back to the Tropicana and take a nap before going out for the *night*...  And even though the service was HELLA slow (to use the parlance of our times), and the beer selection is essentially the LAST straw for a hophead, and it took the bar forever to call our return taxi...  I give C&A a proud 4.5 stars, especially since I fell in love with London a couple years ago and this joint is the closest thing to London for me :)

ub2jXqQ7wt_VQknt_YcIWQ.text: I am a huge fan of C&A, but I have to give it three stars for one major reason--time.  If you are looking to have great  times without dedicating your entire evening to the cause (well, at one place at least!), Crown & Anchor is not for you.  It WILL take you two hours to get three rounds of drinks on a good night.  Err, while I'm at it, I may as well mention parking as well.  I have only lucked out twice with parking at this place, and that was only because I pulled up as someone was pulling out.  On several occasions, my friends and I have parked at Metro across the street or Sherman-Williams and walked over.  Their parking lot is kind of hazardous, anyway.  It's very tight and really difficult to maneuver around in if you get stuck in a sticky place.  But now that I got THAT out of the way (I'm sorry C&A, for I do love you so!), let's get to the goodies.  My friends and I love this place for every reason you could love a pub.  Crown is super cozy and completely raucous at the same time!  When you walk in, you will see people from all walks: older groups enjoy it, the UNLV crowd is pretty big, business people head there after work, and clubbers hit it up for the predancetimebuzz.  Some one mentioned the old wood, and wax, and it takes me back to my Nana Wendy's house.  I sit down and look at the menu and see my family's traditional "home-cooked" foods--shepherd's pie, bangers and hash, scotch eggs, cod and chips, curries--for even though I'm from the South, my father and his family are British!  The imported beers list gives a nice sample of the many great UK (and I mean all the countries involved, not just GB) beers, with plenty on tap.  If you're feeling adventurous, the bartender and *some* of the wait staff are very knowledgeable and will happily recommend something to quench what you're thirstin' fer.    If sitting around outside with a smoke, a beer, and a group of friends at a great pub isn't enough excitement for you, inside they have darts, video poker, and several televisions for your pubbing pleasure.  They also frequently host events aimed at the UNLV crowd, like the British Comedy bash, music, and more.  Hello AbFab costume!!

o7kqOVqrUShXCot9ZrUBhQ.text: BF and I stopped here a couple of weeks ago with  a coupon.  He ordered a martini and I some sort of beer.  Martini was delivered with no olives and I caught the waitress and told her no olives.  She returned sometime later with two olives on a pick, and when she put them into the glass, she pulled them off the pick.  Later I told her that in the future when a martini is served, the olives stay in the drink on the pick.  Guess she didn't serve many martinis.  But I digress.  We started with the garlic mushrooms and a Stilton cheese & crackers plate.  The cheese was good, but the mushrooms were so good we were fighting over them.  I could have made a meal just of those mushrooms.  BF had fish & chips, which he said were good, but not the best ever.  I had lamb stew in Yorkshire pudding, which I thought was fabulous.   Very busy place, and service was a little slow, altho lots of people and not enough waitspeople in my opinion.   However, we will be bringing a big crowd of people back here in March to celebrate an early St. Patty's Day!!!!

omITxfrCO-XWsPaLmKjM2Q.text: I love this place because- i can go there anytime!!! i can ride my bike up to the back patio! i LOVE the patio!!!! You can have an awesome dinner for two and seriously spend under 25 dollars. The staff is friendly , the waitresses wear short skirts but act like ladies. Its not a 4 star english dining experience if thats what you are looking for its a laid back fun pub with a dart board and a bad ass beer selection!  and delish food. Bangers and mash are good, and the chips are always light and crunchy .

hruV69FqLpC3NZj9Bxadog.text: I love this place. It is right around the corner from my house so it is easy to get to (for me). The food is good, not the greatest, but solid for sure. The place is more run down than it should be, the owner should look into touching it up. But if you are looking for a place with great staff this place is great. The bartenders and servers are so unique that it makes it fun every time. My friends and I go to Karaoke Wednesdays and Dollar PBR Sundays all the time.

g1i1lHw3DJxWH_DHjQbNUg.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas and want to watch my Arsenal play I make sure to hit up the Crown & Anchor.  That means I'm showing up around 6 in the AM and I probably did not sleep at all the night before.  There's a great beer selection but I can't really comment on the food (although I've been told it's good) because each time I've been there I've been just way too drunk to remember anything except the Scotch Eggs.  And those are perfect for eating after you've downed a few pints.  The last time I was in Vegas we showed up at the C&A so early in the morning it was still dark.  We stayed all day as some lads from England were in town for a stag party (bachelor party to us Yanks) and we ended up drinking with them all day.  The staff was friendly and great fun to chat with the whole time as well (I think we may have even received a couple of free drinks).  By the time we left it was dark again.    We didn't step out into the sun all day and we weren't even in a casino!

Xl_5WR7Wr7jK8fb20UzVeA.text: I hate to give this place three stars, because it's actually one of my favorite bars in Las Vegas, but there are some reasons why I don't come here much anymore.  The beer selection is great for me, because I am a big fan of British beers.  This might be the only place in the city that has Bombardier Ale on tap.  The food is very good, and the prices are reasonable.  The problems:   The prices on beer seem to have gone up quite a bit over the last couple of year.  This used to be a good place to come for a couple of $5 drinks, but on the last couple of visits I payed close to $14 for two beers.  Their Happy Hour prices are a little cheaper, but not much.  I really hate to mention this, but there is a roach problem here.  If you sit outside, you're going to see a ton of roaches.  That's not such a big deal, but I have also had the same problem when sitting at the bar.  If you are coming here to eat, I would HIGHLY recommend that you sit at a table in the restaurant part of the room.  I have only eaten food on the bar-top twice, and both times there were roaches crawling around on the condiment bottles and near my food.  The food is really good, though, so I will certainly eat here again, just not at the bar.

qirAuFtVFF9TJpjEayesLg.text: Was told this place had soccer games. Called to find out if they had the la galaxy game (which was on fox sport west) and was told "we have all the soccer games, we've never missed one". Although the guy had no idea who the galaxy were and was not knowledgeable about soccer.  We drove a few miles there.  The waitress had no clue to anything soccer related and simply pointed to a schedule chalkboard.  As expected only premeir league games.  What made this especially upsetting was that they were playing a college (american) "football" game on one tv.  This place does not play any major league soccer games and instead shows college football!!!! Also, so much for the "we never miss a game" I was told in reference to major league soccer.  But the guy obviously had no idea what he was talking about and I was skeptical going there in the first place.

EF2KGe_zyBNSq5_Taf0Obg.text: When I went here, it was a great atmosphere. Very bustling and the staff were very friendly. The food was absolutely amazing... guinness stew was what my bf had, and he shared some of it with me, and I had bangers and mash. (I'm not even normally a fan of sausage, but authentic british food... hey...)  They do lose 1 star for slow service. It took forever to get our check when it was time for our group to go and when we did get it, they had screwed up a bit on it. That was the only thing wrong with the entire visit, though.

JlAzLDm5eVRS7P1hTZakpA.text: I would probably give this place between a 3.5 stars and a 4.0.  Food: I had an avocado and turkey sandwich that came with French fries. I thought the avocado was fine, but the bread was a bit dry. I would have preferred less fries and instead maybe a cold slaw side or some salad side accompanying it. 3.0 for the food.  Beer: Both my friend and I had the summer ale. I have to say that it was pretty good. I forgot to ask them if they brewed it themselves, but this pub has an extensive list of beer including imports. The summer ale is a special and it included a dose of citrus. Pretty good light beer. I normally don't drink and even I thought this was refreshing.  Service: Our waitress was very friendly. She also invited my friend and I to the quiz night going on that evening even though we did not go to it. The outfits at this pub are pretty cute- note very short plaided skirts. The food was brought out relatively fast along with the beer.  Parking: Ample parking in a private lot (free).  Payment: Takes credit card.  Location: It's off strip and pretty close to the freeway. One can probably take a cab here or drive here if you have a car.  Overall, the pub was pretty friendly and our waitress was awesome. The food was okay, but the beer made up for it. I also filled out a survey with comments and it will be entered for a $25 gift card to the pub.

Hye7wjYuJYZDgTxIT8AJXQ.text: Excellent prices and awesome fish n chips! It is located very close to the strip, about five minutes away from the MGM.  We went here on the day of the Queen's Jubilee and they had decorated the place with British flags and pictures of the Queen. Very cool. Best place to go to start out the night. It love how it wasn't rowdy at all and that the service was great. They also have a pool table and darts in the back :) Cool, laid-back atmosphere and good food. What more could you ask for?  If I lived in Vegas, this place would definitely be a staple for me :) I will have to go back the next time I am there!

N_RUPJ9kEtenl5_HaYc2FA.text: I generally go the the C&A for the televised football matches (read: soccer games) and from my experience, they generally charge a cover which pisses me off, but I guess it's their right to do so.  I must admit I really do look forward to the chip butty they do (which is basically fries on a buttered roll), great at 6am whilst watching a game!  The rest of the food I've had there is ok, nothing special...haven't tried the fish n chips but as with pretty much anywhere Stateside, the chips aren't 'chip shop' chips, more like 'steak fries'.  The TVs they have for the 'footy' are kinda crap though, especially in the room on the way to the patio, very poor.  Speaking of the patio, I do miss being home in England and having a pint in the sunshine, so this really does hit the spot!  As with a lot of bars in Vegas, I find the service isn't the best, kinda slow as the bar staff of course want to take care of their gaming customers first.  I guess I find it too English at times, especially when there's a big boxing fight in town, it's full of Brits singing shite songs and being obnoxious, something I don't miss about living in England!  All in all, a decent place probably mostly because of the atmosphere and beer selection (the Guinness isn't that great there by the way), but in my mind somewhat over-rated.  Oh, and to Susan R.  it's NOT the same thing as the 'Rose and Crown' you mentioned... that's kind of like saying a Geo Metro is the same as a Cadillac because they're both American cars!

dMhxuC5lBgJ57RvobPw6bQ.text: My new favorite spot in Las Vegas. An authentic British pub (well minus the video poker machines) & I used to live England, so I know what I'm on about! If you want a break from the insanity of the Strip, this is the place to chill out. I had their chicken-leek pie & it was wonderful, fresh & flavorful, the best meal I'd had in weeks. The ambience is dark & cozy, the perky co-eds clad in plaid miniskirts waiting on you are top notch. As I'll be moving to Vegas soon, I'm looking forward to many more evenings in my new hang-out.

ZQ0Ss3OlhwXqAilHHgj2GA.text: Bloody Brilliant! Excellent choice of beers on tap. Outstanding traditional menu. Scotch egg is amazing!  Love this place, you wont find any annoying American football idiots here....

6icslr1JLrP-qhRdwGoCpA.text: Pretty good, but there's a reason the Brits aren't known for their food. Great beer selection, good sausage, other food items were standard meat and potatoes selections at OK prices.  Seemed past it's prime a bit, but I think that may have added some charm more than anything.

3goDlpklwUwZ-YKkFG2Vyw.text: Ever imaged an oasis in the Las Vegas desert? Well, here it is! Great English pub with food and beers to match! The bartenders are nice and the beers are cold. I also tried the sticky toffee pudding and it was pretty average but much appreciated nonetheless.

9XWg_JP_xsylCRI8wF0HwA.text: Sunday was my first visit to big crown. I have been to little crown on spring mt a few times, and never had a bad experience. A couple buddies and me sat at the bar and the bartender came over and informed us that sunday was 1$ PBR night. Well I was looking forward to a Stella or a Bass, but dam, 1 dollar pbr. So I had a couple of those, we also had some of the homemade potato chips and an order of wings.  The potato chips were really thin and broke easily in the curry which could of had a little more flavor.  The wings were decent, kind of your average bar wings. I'd have to give a low rating on the food, but honestly we only tried those two things and nothing off their traditional menu. I will definitely be back to try those becuase the bartender was really nice. He got our orders right, engaged in a bit of small talk, was able to answer questions I had about their happy hour and offered a sample of Bombadier when I asked what kind of beer it was, having never seen it before.   The decor is pretty standard, pictures and UK beer decals. They have a little cove for darts and what sounded like a billards table upstairs. They have a board with all their sports offerings, and special events like karaoke and trivia.  So I will definitely be back for some pints, hopefully of something better next time, but cmon 1 dollar is 1 dollar, amirite?

1cbyJ3S4CKBgNe1bluDZZA.text: I absolutely love this place, it's my favourite pub in Vegas. Food is great (I lived in the UK and this place serves almost authentic meals), staff is friendly and was very helpful when organizing my birthday party there. Will be going back shortly!

zwOFFiEodDOy58aIpOEycQ.text: Strike 1 right off the bat their website homepage says $1 pbrs Sunday night. I order one and they tell me its now $2 and the website hasn't been updated. Strike 2- almost 40 minutes later for my food to come out and I watch as the now off duty bartender gets served his food first, this after he ordered his meal 20 minutes after mine. Strike 3 food arrives and I'm given an excuse that there was a large table that ordered before me; there's only 1 other table ordering food in this whole place. The strike is because of course my meal is cold! The bun was toasted a long time ago and since dried out and the chicken tasted of burnt grill and is dried out. The bartender saw my disgust and offered to refire me a new one. Miraculously a new hot fresh sandwich and fries arrived in under 2 minutes and am told oh yea the cook said your original order may not have been right..... The refire is hot, fresh and tasty but unfortunately my rating still stands because of the 3 strikes. I did get an apology and handshake from the bartender on my way and that speaks for a lot but I can't get over all of the above.

Gx3n_NoCQTxY-K-jWlO_4w.text: Another bar in Vegas..?  No big deal. The BEST bar in Vegas... Now that's saying something! I learned of the C&A when I lived in Vegas several years ago and it quickly became my "let's meet here" place.  They've got a huge selection of beer and cyder on tap.  A great menu, darts and patio dining.  The uni's the waitresses wear are pretty hot too!  But the best part (IMHO) is they play ESPN World on the several TVs scattered around.  Rugby, soccer, Aussie rules football... none of that candy ass baseball they play in most "sports bars".  If you go to Vegas, stop in at the C&A, you won't be disappointed
